reviews.review:
Fantastico!   Casa Di Amore is an incredible Italian restaurant.  It's cozy, authentic and the staff is very friendly.  This is our second time here and it's the best we've had here in Las Vegas so far.  

My wife, bro in law and myself got here about half hour early and they received us with open arms.  They made us feel like old friends.  I had the Eggplant DiAmore, bro in law Shrimp Fetuccini and my wife, good grief, turkey dinner.  And all was delish.  Bottle of red wine, raviolis and mini Osso Bucco.  Molto buona!  Topped off with a canoli and coffee.   Not kidding, this has to be one of the best places to have dinner.  It was our 22nd wedding anniversary and they had the gentleman singing during dinner sing for us.  And guess what?   He sang our wedding song!  What a fabulous evening.  

Casa Di Amore, you are on top of our list in Las Vegas.  Congrats to you and your fabulous staff.

I had heard such positive things about this place, so I had to check it out. Let me just say that it was very good! The food was delicious and the wine our server recommended was perfect. The service and the ambience was even better than I expected. It's such a charming place! I would highly recommend going here for a 
nice Italian dinner.

After driving past this place about a million times (and admiring the bright red, white & green neon sign,) I was finally brought here by my boyfriend for an early Valentine's Day dinner last week. I've heard so many great things about the place, so I was super excited!

We were seated & served immediately by a super charming man (whose name currently slips my mind, sorry!) and the food was fantastic! I highly recommend their calamari & the jumbo ravioli entree.

Casa Di Amore is a small, quaint, romantic Italian restaurant with pretty good food.  It can be a little pricey, but it's worth it for the ambiance.  I ordered the Lobster Ravioli which was quite nice and my friend ordered a steak, which he raved about.  The live music adds just the right mood, with the swooning sounds of Sinatra and a couple bottles of Chianti, who wouldn't feel amorous at the House of Love?
Old school Italian restaurant in Las Vegas off of the strip.  Think Rat Pack meets Elvis. Great good, wonderful service and 3 piece band keeps this place as a must do while visiting Las Vegas !!!

A hidden gem off the Vegas strip. First off, the service is incredible! Everyone was super friendly and appeared to be helping each other out to serve food, refill drinks and clear tables. Even with that, it was still clear who our waitress was and she was super attentive to our needs and was very knowledgeable about the menu and daily specials. I believe her name was Joanne, so kudos to her! She's awesome! The food is here is amazing! I tried the ravioli, but based on the menu, I don't think you can order something "not good" here. The cocktails are also well-made and they certainly don't short you on the liquor. Even the pre-dinner bread is good! :) The manager was present the entire evening and was talking with folks as well as stopping at tables to check on people. He was very nice and welcoming. The live music is also a great bonus to this place! I will absolutely be back here and rant and rave to anyone traveling to Vegas to dine here. As another reviewer said, it is worth the drive from the strip (I believe they also do transportation, but call ahead!) and you should not leave Vegas without dining here. I second that!

We had a large party(about 30 people) here and we were so pleased with the service, food, and ambiance. Kathleen helped us coordinate the party and set a menu. She was very helpful, professional, and accomodating to last minute changes.  They sent two limos to pick us up.  This was really nice!  The drivers were very friendly.
The restaurant is very old school east coast Italian. There was a singer...and he made the restaurant feel very intimate. 
The food was great! The antipasti was really delicious and I was very pleased with the veal piccata. The service was especially wonderful! The wine was flowing...we didn't need to ask for anything!  They were so on top of it!  Brad was especially great!!!  He took extra steps to make sure we were all happy!
Thanks for such a great experience...we will come back on our next trip to Vegas!  We will recommend this place to our friends and family.

We took our friends to this wonderful place last night and had a great time.  Randy and Paul were there playing some great music and took our requests which made the wives happy.  Great food, great music, life is good!

Really, some of the BEST Italian food I've eaten...and, I'm Italian.  The ravioli's reminded me of the ones we used to have in Brooklyn - the sauce was fresh, fantastic and not sweet...which is how most American's mess it up.  The baked clams reminded me of the ones we used to have on Christmas Eve and the chicken special my boyfriend ordered with a pesto cream on top was to die for. Old-school, Vegas atmosphere as great as the food.  Will definitely be back with family and friends for many years to come!

We had Christmas dinner at Casa di Amore and loved it! It was so nice to get off the strip and enjoy truly good food in a nice environment. My steak was absolutely phenomenal - perfectly prepared and served with a delicious peppery sauce. My fiance's linguine and clams was also very good. We had the tiramisu for dessert - delicious. Adding to the great food was the attentive service, unique atmosphere and very enjoyable live music. I would absolutely go back here on our next trip to Vegas and highly recommend it for anyone looking to get off the strip and enjoy a more local dining experience.

Loved  is a great and romantic full energy , life music just make really good place , I went to many fancy places around the are , but here was friendly tony , thank you for you great service , and randy and his music loved .

First time visit, very impressed.  great crowd, live music on Saturday night, more of a neighborhood place, nice alternative to Strip.  We both ordered specials as entrees.  And the cannolis were delicious.

We chose this restaurant based on a restaurant.com certificate we had and read all the terrific reviews.  The food (dinner AND dessert) and the prices didn't put me over the moon, but the service and ambiance were awesome!  Old style Vegas with live music (we were there too early to enjoy the live entertainment; it started shortly before we left).  Our reservation was for 5pm and we walked up to the door to find it locked at 4:55pm.  They should open a little bit earlier for their first reservations.  We would have enjoyed a drink before going to our table.  Everyone raves about the free limo ride, which we passed up because we live in Henderson.  Overall it was a nice experience, but one that I'll only have once as a local.

Very good Chicken Parm and Veal Parm! Also the fried calamari and cannoli was excellent. I would give it 5 stars, but it was much too pricey, in my opinion. I think it should be 3 $$$, not 2. If money isn't that important, then you'll love this place.

The live music was a hit! The caprese and garlic cheese bread were great starters. The gnocchi with cream sauce and prosciutto was amazing!
We will come back again when we are in town!

What a great place.  Just like all the other reviews said.  As soon as we walked on we felt like family.  The band was playing and there was a real buzz the place.  Our server Brad  was wonderful.  You could tell he really enjoyed his job.  The clientele was many locals but we felt at home.  It was classy Italian.  Food was good and drinks were strong.  I can't wait to go back and take my friends.

Service was impeccable but unfortunately I did not only go for the service I went for the food..

I love Italian food and am very Familiar with authentic Italian

The appetizer bread is amazing  but I asked for butter and it tasted like it had been  in the refrigerator wide-open all night. The bread was great with some oil and vinegar.

We had the Lasagna and Eggplant di amor.
Both with fairly dry and we had the server bring us some more marinara and it still didn't do it :( 

All in all we did have the crème brûlée for dessert. It is homemade and was delicious!! 

The service, bread, and crème brûlée are great but if you plan to have a good on entrée based on what I had (which is said to be the favorites)  I would not recommend this place

Ps: the live music and the low lit he ambience is awesome so if you're looking just for a date and not worrying about food or for late-night pizza it would be fine
best time ever !!! bartender Dina makes the best Lemon Drop !!food was great atmosphere was pleasant ... The best out of everything was Dinas lemon Drop martini!!

The wife and I heard great things about the place and so decided to check it out. We stopped by on a Monday because we heard about large crowds on the weekend. The place inside is a bit dark and reminds one of being back in the 50's and maybe catching Dino and Frank sitting in a corner enjoying a meal together. They had a singer who sang some great tunes. Our waiter was very pleasant and he walked us through the menu and we ordered several dishes and a bottle of sparkling spumante wine. All in all it was a great place to eat and recommend that anyone headed to Vegas should stop by and enjoy a great Italian meal. Don't forget to order a cannoli for desert too....

Pros:
Good and friendly service
Free limo (I doubt otherwise the place would be popular - quite far from The Strip)
Nice, home-like atmosphere

Cons:
Food. Poor presentation, very average taste, absolutely nothing memorable.

Fantastic food. Simple solid classic menu. Great service from a staff that wants you to enjoy yourself. Lots of locals eat here. Limo service to Strip hotels is a great touch.., love this place, we come here whenever we get to Vegas!

When Ruben and I get together with one of our group of friends (dubbed the "Eight-some"), someone else always plans the dinner, so we are just along for the ride. We came here last Friday night and definitely needed that reservation. The restaurant is small and there's practically no waiting area/lobby, so the hostess stand is very crowded. Our table was in the middle of the restaurant, right next to the bar, kitchen, and two-man band. Luckily, the booth seat is tall, so our view of the bar and kitchen were blocked.

Everyone enjoyed the complimentary bread and particularly the garlic butter that accompanied it. Ruben and I shared the Fried Calamari ($16) served with marinara and a side Caesar Salad ($3 with entree). Ruben ordered Pasta Alla Forno ($30) created with penne, chicken, shrimp, broccoli, and mushrooms in a light pink sauce, then baked in the oven with fresh mozzarella. While I had their Baked Lasagna ($21) filled with marinara, fresh ricotta, ground beef, Italian seasonings, and melted mozzarella. The calamari was good (didn't make my top 5 though) and I liked their marinara. The Pasta Alla Forno was very delicious! Great flavor and the shrimp was especially good. Although, very expensive for a dish of pasta. The lasagna was all right, borderline meh.  Way too much cheese and not enough sauce. It was really difficult for me to eat (I ate less than half). One of our friends ordered Tiramisu and I thought it was decent.

The band was really great! Very talented gentleman and I loved the music they played. The only thing was that with our big group, we couldn't talk to each other much since one end of the table was directly next to the band. Service was really great. Everyone was great, nice, and attentive. The restaurant has a really nice atmosphere and exemplifies "Old School Vegas." It's definitely a cool spot to check out. As far as Italian food goes, it was just okay and not worth the cost.

FYI: Great for families - we had an 8-month old with us and it wasn't too loud or rowdy for her. Also, the automatic gratuity is 20% for groups of 6 or more.

We had read reviews about this restaurant and booked it for Christmas dinner and we're so happy we did. The entire experience was one I will never forget. First they offer free limo service from your hotel you just have to call ahead of time and reserve it, then when you walk into the place it is like stepping back in time The service was great and the food was tremendous. I got the Scallops Florentine, One of my sons got the twin fillet mignon, and my other son got steak flambé. We all got the Caesar salad to go with that and everybody loved their meals. To top it off they have live entertainment with just a variety of old music and it appears they take requests. We figured this restaurant had been around since the 60s but found out it's only been around for about 13 years you wouldn't know it and it was just like old Vegas.

Honestly such a hidden gem went in last night and our server Michael was awesome. Very knowledgeable and attentive. The bread is to die for we got full off bread and salad. And our entrees were the best Italian we've had in vegas! And their live band was a great definitely will be doing back!!!

excellent local italian restaurant off the strip.
food very good and reasonably priced .
staff are terrific.  very friendly, never an attitude.
highly recommend.
mike s
henderson
Stefan... Very cool dude. Working to be a stand up giant.  Oh, by the way, the food here is really good!

Casa Di Amore successfully tries to recreate the Rat Pack era vibe with it's ambience, music, and food. The food is excellent and reasonably priced. The lounge singer hit all the right notes with his Sinatra decade music. But our waiter, Brad, made it memorable with his service and quips. He was helpful but not intrusive. Corny but funny.

This was our favorite dinner in Vegas!  We went based on Yelp and Tripadvisor reviews- so glad I did my research, or I NEVER would have found this spot.  We took a cab (didn't know about the complimentary limo service!) and I started to wonder where the hell we were going- it was a 20.00 cab ride from the strip.  When we finally got there, the cabbie said we shouldn't have a problem getting back because the machine gun range next door was very popular with the tourists...

We walked in and were promptly seated by the hostess, who told us that the musician was taking a break but would be back soon (singing keyboard player who interacted w/willing dinner guests). Our server was extremely helpful and luckily, we were there on 1/2 priced wine night (Sun and Mon) so we got an excellent Chianti.  

We started off w/the calamari, which was wonderful and there was a ton of it!  It was very crisp and had a lovely marinara sauce.  I had the 'grandma's' soup, which was delicious- chicken noodle-y and very flavorful.  I was in the mood for red sauce, so the server recommended a sausage pasta dish that was normally served w/a pink sauce, but said he'd make it w/red (amazing!!!)  My husband had a strip steak which was served w/a twice baked potato and veggie...all good. 

When it was time for desert, we declined- but our server said we had to try the cannoli and we'd get a t-shirt...I'm a sucker for a free t, so we got it to go.  
The server told us about the limo service and said that the driver was off because nothing had been scheduled- but that his manager was more than happy to take us to our hotel.  We took him up on the offer and rode back to the strip in style. 
 
I'd recommend this restaurant to anyone, in fact, I gave away the card our server gave us w/his name on it (Christopher?) to another trade show attendee.  Sorry that I can't give his name, because he was great!

Later, while walking down the strip, we passed a particularly hungry looking homeless guy.  I asked if he was hungry, he said he was starving...I offered him our leftovers.  He happily took them and was very grateful.  About 3 minutes later, I realized I'd given away my souvenir t-shirt, but I bet he needed it more than I did.

We loved this place!  From the amazing staff to the two band members, it was a wonderful experience   
The   is a must as well as the cannoli for dessert!
You wil fee as if you stepped back in time to the "old" Las Vegas days....

I LOVE this place. The food is delicious, the service is fantastic, and the ambience is to die for. It's your italian family restaurant, with the Frank Sinatra singer that makes you feel all mushy inside ( in a good way!). I've been here for dinner, and My best friend's wedding reception was here too. It was divine. You don't HAVE to dress up here, but isn't always nice to get a tiny bit dressed up to feel fabulous at a good restaraunt? Also, you can get picked up by their limo is you call to make a reservation!
Casa Di Amore is wonderful, you won't regret going there!

as an extremely serious italian cuisine critic blathering from a mouth spanning from generations of proud & well-fed italiano descendants, I typically dined @ Casa di Amore tenuously. The gnocchi was pretty good, salmon was exceptional and the service was very friendly & knowledgable. Entertainment very nice, and the dark lighting & photos throughout of old Vegas very comforting. The crowd was very loud and boisterous, enhancing the old italian family dining experience. No surprise that the pricing was way out of line though. fifty bucks for a decent dinner and a cocktail?... seriously, like they should be spoon-feeding me & wiping my chin @ those prices.
Great food, atmosphere & service. The fried calamari is the best in Vegas. Don't forget to have a cannoli and get a t-shirt on the house.

What a great time.  Great staff, great music, and Fantastic Food and drink all the way thru from the calamari to the cannoli and creme brûlée.  Ribeye flambé was perfect with a great peppercorn sauce.  The gnocchi and spaget with meatballs were both exceptional.  Yelp did not disappoint on this place.   If I wasn't on a gluten free thing I'd have even been more impressed - did sample a corner of the house bread with oil/balsamic and that ended up the only part of the meal I regret.  In the past I would have ordered a side of the house-made marinara and gone to town.

Food was okay. Service from Lynn not so friendly and personable if you are comparing it to the other gentleman waiter. She never took the time to greet us and explain specials or come back to check on us periodically. When we asked her questions, it was like we bothered her. If it wasn't for the other waiter being so nice to the other table, I would not come back here.

Great food, great service,  and great atmosphere!  We were told it would be a 30min-1hr wait so we went to the bar (bartenders were very nice) 
We had just left Annies gourmet Italian restaurant and had a horrible experience!  
We were only at the bar for about 10 minutes and my girlfriend had told the manager "Smitty" what had happened at the last restaurant, we were starving!  After hearing our story Smitty came right over and got us a table!  Awesome!!! Or server, i think his name was Bret or Brad, was great!  Eggplant was soooo good. As was the bruchetta and gypsy pasta with meatballs. ..can't wait to go back!

Someone pinch me because this was the BEST italian food I have ever had! Such an old school place and I can't believe how  many times I drove by it and never stopped in. It looks unsuspecting on the outside but goodness...the food is to die for! The marinara sauce is the stuff dreams are made of and the Eggplant di Amore? OH LAWD! I've gone to this place twice already and I will definitely be going again in the future.  Oh...and make sure you try the garlic loaf. AMAZEBALLS!

I had the baked mostaccoli and my girlfriend had the pasta al forno. I have to say pasta is my favorite food and it's tough to disappoint me, but we were disappointed. 

The noodles were slightly overcooked and the pasta al forno had no sauce in it. It was a pool of grease. 

After seeing the photos on Yelp I have decided to go back and try some other dishes before giving up on them. We also had the calamari which was also a mediocre 3 stars. For the price we definitely wouldn't relive this meal, but we'll try them again.

The live music bumped my review up to a 3, otherwise this would be a 2.

I am so confused by the positive reviews. I ordered takeout at 2am... Spaghetti meat sauce... A very difficult dish to mess up... Not exaggerating when opened the lid it literally smelled like DOG FOOD. Like a literal can of dog food. That smell. WTF????? The texture of the meat was grainy (how??? I don't understand; it was bizarre). I took a bite and called them back. There was very little sauce so I at first asked for more sauce, thinking maybe that would help. NO. There was something wrong with the meat. Mind you this is a $22.50 spaghetti meatsauce that smelled like dogfood. I don't even know how someone in their right mind could serve that to a customer... And charge $22.50... What????? The server and the manager dealt with the situation professionally and promptly so this review is not for them. They gave me a spaghetti meatball instead and gave me a canolli on the house. The canolli was great, but the dish they gave me was also sub par (waay too salt and i'm a salt addict)... not what you expect for $22.50 LOL!!! This review is for the cook: you need to re learn proper food handling/ safety because the 2 bites of your dogfood spagetti meatsauce MADE ME SICK. I will spare you the details. I cannot even wrap my mind around the ridiculous $22.50 price. How long was that sitting there???? Was that an old dish that was sitting there that you tried to get rid of? How old was the sauce and was it kept at the proper temp? There's no way. Would you serve that to your friends or family???? Would you pay $22.50 for that dish???? How would you feel if you were sick from eating it? Would you be pissed enough to write a one star Yelp review? Seriously, relearn proper food handling/ safety skills. If the health department came in there and saw you serving that, you would be shut down.
their pizza is the closest thing to east coast pizza. mmmm. the feel is old school vegas and they have a guy that sings frank sinatra and dean martin song. so cute for a nice date night.
One word. Incredible. The food is the best. I grew up on this food. The capizzoli's are the reason I need a diet, but damn, it's worth it.

Absolutely delicious! My boyfriend and I got picked up by a limo and taken to the restaurant. The limo driver even asked if we would like to come earlier and was waiting outside the hotel for us. When we arrived, the place was packed, there was a singer and a Sax player, both very good. Our waiter was the best and even took our picture for us. I ordered the mojito, super good and not overpowering. I had the penne a la vodka in a giant bowl. I couldn't eat even half of it. Halfway into our dinner, everyone was singing "That's Amore" with the singer. I love this place because it isn't pretentious like the restaurants you find on the strip. I even got a shirt that says "We have medical marinara" I'm really happy we chose this place for our anniversary dinner!

Nice old school Vegas look and feel. Very small, so I recommend a reservation. I had lasagna, my friend had chicken parm, and we had the garlic loaf....everything was amazing! Another nice thing, they are open until 5am....perfect for vegas lol!
Amazing food! The live entertainment was incredible. . Not a cheap place but worth it for date night!

Half locals, half tourists, this place perfectly captures a 1960's New Jersey Italian restaurant. It's that red sauce Italian all the way, but damn good. The atmosphere is perfect off-strip Vegas: it simulates some other time & place, but does it so authentically that you'd almost think that this is what a Northeast Corridor Italian restaurant is still like. Which is to say: the locals nay not even fully realize how impossible it is to find a joint like this in the rest of the US anymore. Mostly, it's the most enjoyable restaurant experience I've ever had in Las Vegas.

Made a reservation for 8:15 for 2 and still wasn't sat til 10:30. By then we no longer wanted to stay. Loud and obnoxious atmosphere. Live music was awful. Osso buco sucked and so did the inattentive host Lisa. We left immediately after we were sat and went to CAPO'S on Sahara where the food was phenomenal and the (live) music was beautiful. Real Chicago Italian in a romantic setting, it was a perfect ending to my birthday dinner. I do not recommend casa di amore.

Love this place... The food is terrific, the staff is super friendly! Feels like an old local Italian restaurant in Chicago! Love the live music on weekends and the old world feel... Again, the food is terrific!!!!

This is a great restaurant in a random location. Hint: You can request free limo service from anywhere on the Strip. It's quite small, so definitely make a reservation.

The ambiance and decor are the true draw of this spot. It's very old school Vegas. There are old school pictures of Vegas and various celebrities all around the restaurant and bar.

At the rear of the restaurant is the bar. There's video poker, of course. Hint: If waiting at the bar for a table to be ready, they cannot transfer your drink bill to your table, so you must pay the bartender before being seated at your table. There are several cocktails and a few wines by the glass. The wine menu was a little underwhelming.

Despite trying to be more upscale and fancy-ish, this is a rather casual spot. There were kids running around and lots of folks in jeans and sweatshirts.

The live music is a great touch and adds to the ambiance and decor. However, it also escalates the noise level. Between the band and the patrons, we couldn't even hear each other - and we were at a tiny two person table. Hint: Request a booth on the far side from the band. There's some seriously awful acoustics in this place. The noise level and the inability to carry on a conversation with your date really kills the romance.

For food, we opted for a side caesar salad, the bone-in ribeye steak flambe and the gypsy pasta. The food portions are pretty generous. The salad was nothing of note. Hint: While there's free bread, they don't give you olive oil and balsamic vinegar, just butter. The steak was tasty, but not mouthwatering or crave-worthy. The gypsy pasta was crazy spicy - and I love spicy. It was almost too much it was so spicy. And the pastas are 1 lb, so it was a significantly large portion.

The service was nice and friendly. Our waters were never empty, we were checked on, etc., etc.

All in all, I like the concept, which is what gives it the 4 stars. And I'd be willing to come back, perhaps on a less busy night, and try some other menu items. But I didn't love what we ordered and the noise level seriously dampened our experience. While a good spot if you're looking for a vintage Vegas vibe, If you're looking for a nice, romantic restaurant, this is not that spot. But totally good for experiencing that old school Vegas feel.

Hit this for a friends birthday. I was impressed with the food and the atmosphere is classic vegas. A lounge band and singer really get the place moving and it is something that really feel like an old school experience. 

Food was good. No complaints form our party and everyone was pretty satisfied. I would recommend for family style itialian with a Vegas lounge feel. Probably best for parties and large groups as the accomodation just feel that way. Also, have a limo service that will pick you up form the strip areas and drop you off. A nice feature for parties.

Ever feel like you want to experience old school Vegas? Walk into Casa Di Amore and its like walking into a time warp. Classic pictures on the walls, dark leather and warm brick, ambient lighting. Live music every night, impeccable service, fantastic menu. Our server Robert was on top of things! Wine glasses were never empty, his menu selections were spot on, and we felt like we were family. The bus boy was like a thief in the night.... We never knew he was there but somehow our water was always filled and our empty plates mysteriously disappeared from the table. Food was delicious. Calamari was lightly breaded and crispy. My eggplant was stuffed with cheese and spinach and still managed to stay firm. Hubby had cannelloni with ground veal that melted in your mouth. A word to the wise, they are closed on Tuesdays and MAKE A RESERVATION! We happened to walk in on a Monday night and there was one open table. ONE! There is a small bar area with a few open  2 person booths. Just goes to show how amazing this place is that a Monday is standing room only.

Makes you feel special, offered us complementary limo service on our next trip, (we were staying at Sam's town, and they still offered the limo.) The lounge act harkens back to an earlier vegas style, and the food had great prices for proper portion sizes.

Hey Now!
This place is really old school Vegas.. The Mafia looking owner greets you at the door, great nightly entertainment. Food is genuine Italian. Service is outstanding. They even have a stretch limo valet both ways for just a tip!
We make sure to stop in every trip. Members of R.com, and they have a coupon in this year's LVA MRB..

Fantastic experience, great ambiance, and top tier service. My friends were in town for our one year college reunion, so we took advantage of the free limo ride to the restaurant. You can't really beat that. The food an atmosphere are excellent. There was a live musician ready and willing to take requests. It's a little on the noisy side, but not bad at all. 

Although the food is fantastic, what really made this place excel was the service. Our waiter never missed a beat. He was funny, informative, told us the history of the restaurant, and made sure our wine glasses were never empty. Highly recommended. 

It was very busy on Saturday night, so I would suggest making reservations.

Wanted to like this place. Took the family here for dinner. The entertainment was the best part of the night. Food was average @ best. Super expensive for what it was and compare both the quality and $ to the strip. It was loud which was not quite what we were expecting. If this is old Vegas I'm happy to keep it in the past.

I went to Casa di Amore, or as I like to call it, "Casa di A... MORE PLEASE!" with my friends Pat, Kohl, Nick, Gilburt, Yabo, Mensah, Shawn, and Masoli. Our waitress was a quick-wristed, Italian woman called Guiseppe. Masoli organized the dinner, so he put a lot of pressure on everyone at the table to order foods that rhyme with his name. Unfortunately, this limited us to ravioli and cannolis. The live music was incredible, although some of the lyrics were a little bit different from what I remembered (e.g. "when the moon hits your eye like a big pizza pie that's Masoli"). The women there were much nicer than most women. Instead of getting angry when I asked them questions on their way to the bathroom, they just ignored me. Guiseppe gave me a cannoli even though I didn't order one. In Italy, this means a woman is in love with you. "Cannoli" literally translates to "little tube". The suggestion was obvious; she wanted a little tube in return. I decided I couldn't reciprocate the gesture when I saw Guiseppe offering cannolis to literally everyone. Casa di Amore:  Masoli, ravioli, cannoli

Me and my wife come here every year, they pick us up in a limo and take you to the restaurant, the restaurant has a live singer, nothing but the best love songs, its very affordable, the fodd is GREAT!!!! I didnt want to yelp it as I dont want anyone to go, LOL!!!! must reserve in advance!

More like 4.5 

First time I walked in here, I was a little scared that I might be walking into the Mob's headquarters. But after we were seated, boy was I charmed by this place.

There's live entertainment on the weekends (not sure about other times) and that man can sing! He knows how to work up the crowd and get people dancing. It's just a feel good environment and everyone makes you feel like family in there. 

First time I came, there were 3 of us and we decided to share everything we ordered: the antipasto sampler, eggplant di amore, gnocchi alla prosciutto, and their special of the night which was a herb chicken with pasta. The food was nothing short of amazing, except for the gnocci. It was too rich for my liking. Cheese sauce plus the gnocchi, which are just potato dumplings, was just too much. But other than that, food was pretty great.

Second time, my bf and I started off with their fabulous garlic loaf. When they say fabulous, they mean FABULOUS. It was stuffed with garlicky cheese and just hot out of the oven. Delizioso! Then we had the twice wrapped prawns which had a tasty sweet walnut sauce. It was pretty good but I'd say it could use less filo dough and more prosciutto and cheese. Still not bad though. Lastly, we had the fettuccine alla pappasito and that was excellent. The sausage was spiced perfectly and there was a large helping of them. Also, usually if you split an entree, they'll charge $5, but our waiter just brought out an extra plate for us to split it at the table so the $5 charge was waived. Super nice of him!

This place has been fun times each time I came and I think there will be many more visits here. Good food, live entertainment, great restaurant!
Very good and authentic Italian food, great staff and atmosphere. Hidden gem and great local spot

We went to Casa di Amore last night for dinner and it was perfect. Even though we arrived at 830 on a Saturday night without a reservation, the hostess didn't give us any attitude, she just directed us to the bar. We ordered drinks and bruschetta and chatted and listened to the live music. About 30 minutes later they called us to a table, which seemed quite reasonable given the crowd.

Our server was friendly and prompt, and the food was great. We all thought the live music was a plus - more interesting than canned music, but at a volume where we could still talk. It's nice to have a place where you can hold a conversation without having to shout.

We left with wonderful memories and will definitely come back on our next trip to Vegas.

If you are looking for a place to have a romantic dinner or just a place with a gourmet feel, this is definitely the place to go! It's off of the strip so you don't have the loud noise of the casino atmosphere in the background. They'll also come pick you up in a limo if you request (for free I believe). The food was absolutely delicious, but what made this visit special was our waiter. Brad was the best waiter I think I have ever had at a restaurant! He was very attentive but not overly in your face. He was very professional but fun. Overall I would definitely eat here again and recommend this place to any and everyone!

We stopped for a couple of nights in Vegas on our way to Scottsdale AZ for Spring Training.  After checking around for dinner places to celebrate our 25th anniversary, we decided on Casa di Amore based on other Yelpers' reviews.  We wanted someplace off the Strip that locals might go to.  And boy, did Casa di Amore deliver! It looked & felt like old Vegas, during the Rat Pack days.  The décor, the entertainment, the 'feel'; it has it all.  An added bonus was it was half-price wine Monday.  ALL bottled wines are half price!  

The service was above & beyond from our waitress, Lynn.  She let us taste a couple of wines before buying. (She also let me try the gnocchi before I ordered but asked me not to tell so this is our little secret.)  Hubby had the rib eye with cabernet demi-glaze & peppercorn sauce. It was cooked to perfection. I had the gnocchi florentine with prosciutto in a white wine cream sauce. Lynn said we can request any ingredients be added or removed so I added sautéed mushrooms.  M-M-M!  Desert was a wonderful tiramisu.

The live entertainment was a two-man combo, keyboard & drums. They looked like they could have played the Sands or the Stardust way back when. The dinner music just adds that little 'something' to make the night special.

Gr8 old Vegas ambience.  My meals have been inconsistent.  Had baked eggplant dish di casa which was overcooked.  Other times, I have had perfectly prepared dishes.  Place is a cross BTW a romantic dinner getaway and a loud party place.  Service can be inconsistent too.  Otherwise, nice menu selections, generous servings and comfortable booths.

This is an interesting place. Some of the better Italian food I have had in town and the wine wasn't bad, either. Real meat or cheese ravioli instead of the pretentious spinach or Swiss chard type you get at the high-end Strip Italian restaurants. Atmosphere is very old school with posters of Vegas as it used to be. The dining room feels a bit cramped and service can be slow. The bar at the back diminishes the place a little, because its appearance and the crowd it attracts remind one of a sleazy dive from the 70's. 

Singer/keyboard player Doug and 83-year-old violinist Bill entertained on Sunday night and were excellent - both very talented guys and not too loud.

The biggest drawback for tourists is that it is located a good long way from the Strip. It's right next door to The Gun Store, making it a good place to complete your Vegas Mafia Experience after trying out that machine gun you've been itching to get your hands on. ;)
The food was awesome!!! The decore is of "old Vegas"  aka frank Sinatra you can definitely see some of the rat pack ratting here!! I had the stuffed chops two 8oz delicious

This is the first time that I ate at this restaurant.( considering we eat out 6 nights a week)
The following is my review...
1. Caesar Salad: 4stars
2. Side order of meatballs: 4 stars
3. Chicken Parm: 4 stars

Place was really nice and food is great. The hostess is not very bright. Be careful because she will seat you and not assign you a waiter or waitress. Bird for brains! Hostess has very poor customer service skills for such a nice place!

The two stars are solely for the entertainment director and the 2 guys in the black shirts that kept checking on us. Came in on a Saturday night, pretty busy; we were seated quickly though. Our water was so awkward and disconnected, was so off-putting. The food was the biggest disappointment. The lamb on the bed of risotto tasted like dirt. The chicken francaise (sp)? tasted like the entire bottle of salt was dumped on it. And the water...I think the ditch water might have tasted better. The entertainment director told us to tell our waiter it was our sons birthday bc they do a little something special...aaaaaannnddd nothing. Needless to say our waiter can kick rocks and he didn't get tipped. The entertainment and our two runner guys got the tip. Thanks guys. We won't be back...ever.

We went here last night and ordered the lasagna and vodka penne pasta also the cannoli and got a free shirt! The wine is half off on Mondays on full bottles and we ordered our favorite type of Italian wine sangovase. Tony was our server and he was one of the best servers I've ever had. We loved the experience so much I can't get over it!... We will be back ASAP!!!!!!!! Total the night was 100$ which was great for a bottle of wine, dessert and 2 entries

At any moment, Sammy Davis Jr. and Frank Sinatra could walk through the doors. Okay, not really because they're dead, but Casa di Amore has nailed the old school Vegas vibe.

The servers were well-polished and unpretentious. Even the manager was extremely hospitable and treated us like family.

My family and I ordered the following: 

Lasagna    A
Chicken Marsala    A
Eggplant parmigiana   B
Fettuccine Alfredo   B

The pasta is made in house, which I love. Now if that weren't enough, you also get FREE entertainment. That's right, live music and the singer has a lot of soul. If you're fortunate enough to chat with him, he'll share fascinating stories about everybody who's anybody in the music industry.

This place stays crowded, so make reservations.

Short trip off the Las Vegas strip! Excellent Food!  We had a party of 29 people!  Service was top notched! I had the Shrimp in Vodka, I wish I had taken some to go!  Would go just for this place.   It gives you the ambieance of an old Las Vegas club and the singer they had that night wasn't bad!  If your in Vegas you gotta try this place out.

Went out on Yelp and read the reviews. Went to setup a reservation through Yelp and the earliest we could get a reservation was 2 hours out. Called the restaurant and they confirmed they could take us with in 1 hour. Of course, we opted for the 1 hour. Our party was eight people.

The staff was lovely as well as the food. The portions were large and we were able to split meals between two people. The staff was okay with the splitting of meals and continued to give us great service.

The atmosphere reminded me of old style Las Vegas of the 60s and 70s. Tables were set in such a way you felt like you had your own space and were not sitting on top of others. The booths were in the old style as well. The entertainer for the night sang mostly Sinatra and Martin songs. He did an an outstanding job.

The next time I am in Vegas, I will be eating here again.

Want a great meal with live music and old school Vegas feel, then look no further. Loved it here. I wanted Italian and googled best Italian in Vegas and this was number four. When I looked at the other places they seemed so snooty and I didn't want to get all dressed up. So this seem to be the easy choice. What great service and the prices were unbelievable for Vegas. A must from now on when I visit. No 1 in Vegas as far as I'm concerned. Thank you for the great meal.

My husband and I went here while we were in Las Vegas. It was my first time!! I LOVED this restaurant and it will be a favorite, when we go to Vegas! The food was great, there's live entertainment and out waiter, Brad, made the night!! I HIGHLY recommend going here!!!
We go there every time we go to Vegas and once we went on valentine day great food and very friendly staff this would be the fifth time in three years

Great food, wonderful atmosphere, service and music.  Perfect spot before or after the airport. Eggplant di Amore was delicious and huge portions.  Stuffed garlic bread is amazing and the wine selections and prices are fair.  We will definitely be back. *I heard they offer half portions of entrees if you ask so this would be a good idea unless you are splitting.  It's a little loud with the music so not ideal for a quiet dinner but you can get a table further away from the stage if you make a reservation.

Wow, the staff at this restaurant ROCKS, they are some of the best I have ever seen, everyone has a smile on their face and is such a pleasure.  The food is very good, the place is loud, talking is very hard,  They have some great live music, so just be prepared to have some good food and very little conversation.  The only disappointment was the 'Fabulous Garlic Loaf', man, my mother could kick the crap out of that.  I was expecting this great Italian bread loaded with garlic and butter and baked to perfection, what I got was a hot loaf of bread and some garlic butter...really, for $5?  You guys should re-think this.  But, the place is always full and the food is good and the staff is AWESOME!  I will be back.

It's funny that I went here after I watched the Anthony Bourdain where he bemoans the trend of traditional Italian-AMERICAN food disappearing, as it dissolves into a mishmash of regional cuisines of Italy. Is there something shameful about a veal parm? Not in my book, and not in Bourdain's either.

Old school, dark walls, candles on the table. I also had the pleasure of watching the Godfather on AMC's mob week before I went here, so it was awesome seeing pictures of old Vegas like the Sands with Dino and Frankie on the marquee. They send a limo to pick you up, and all you have to do is tip the driver. 

Onto the food! Well first the wine. Their wine list was surprisingly pricey, but the cheap 30 dollar chianti was a solid pick. The bread was uninspired, the butter clearly pre-frozen. I ordered the pork chop saltimbucca, half order, because TWO 8oz pork chops is a little too much. It was pretty good, a little salty. My friends ordered lasagna, fettuccine, eggplant parm. I tried all of them, and while it's nice to have these italian american classics around, I could have made these at home for half the price, easy. However, it's a solid place and I liked that it was off the strip and not touristy as hell.

This was a great restaurant and if you want to get off the strip and get a taste of classic old Las Vegas, I would highly recommend this restaurant.  Make sure that you ask for the complimentary limo service when you call to make your reservations.  The limo picked us up from our hotel and took us to a non-descript brick building.  The moment the big heavy door opened for us to walk into the restaurant, you could smell the delicious Italian food and hear the sounds of a two-man band singing classic Italian love songs.  We were in love from the get-go!  There were old photos of the original hotels on the strip and infamous Vegas icons on the walls.  The food was good, not necessarily outstanding, but good.  It was worth the price.  They also had their wines at 50% off for the bottle, which made it totally worth it.  Afterwards, our limo driver actually took us downtown to Fremont Street so that we could enjoy that experience and then we cabbed it back to our hotel on the strip.  It was a good time.
Great baked clams, desserts are good, fresh ravioli awesome. Service was terrific. This place reminds me of the Italian restaurants in NY

Another great dinner with co-workers. We come here every time we come to Vegas for a trade show. Never disappointed!  

I had the scallops au gratin this eve (without the mushrooms) and it was delicious. Melted in my mouth. 

Excellent service. Great atmosphere with live entertainment. 

A must go place to eat when you visit Vegas!

Went here this past Thursday night around 10pm. Reserved the limo to pick us up from the Strip. He was early and it was perfect because we were hungry, free limo ride was awesome.  The place is cute, decor was inviting and i liked the setup. Four of us came her to check out the place (first timer's) was thinking of maybe booking it for a dinner reception after our wedding next year. We all shared two entree's (cus it was pretty late to be eating Italian food) and two side salads and bread. The lasagna was really yummy, we ordered some chicken dish i cant remember the name but none of us cared for it the chicken was a little dry, but the pasta it was served with was good.  The entertainment was alright not as exiting as all the other yelp'ers made it come across. Maybe we came too late?? Anyways we will be back, but i don't think we will be booking our dinner reception here afterall, only because it is away from the Strip and i think i would prefer more of a banquet hall facility.

Place was packed and looked like a great neighborhood place to go. Very friendly for sure.  Wine by the glass was on tap.  Not a fan of tap wines.  We both ordered the specials. My husband loved his. Mine was lobster & asparagas, but almost non-existent; mostly cheese and pasta.  I think if we'd stuck with something like spaghetti or lasagna and ordered a bottle of wine, I would have thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

The food was tasty though I didn't really eat much because an hour before going, I had just stuffed myself at a buffet the way you do when visiting Vegas. So I'm just going to discuss it point by point:

The limo to the restaurant is awesome! The really nice driver picked us up in front of TI and drove us to the restaurant and back. He was really patient. At the end of the night, he had another party to pick up but was really nice about getting us to make up our minds whether we wanted to go or wait until he came back.

The server was awesome! He was super sweet and really helpful when my sister and I couldn't figure out what wine we wanted. I also kept running to the bar area to watch the SC game at one point after ordering a new bottle and he brought my glass to me at the bar. Sweet! :o)

The bar area has the standard bar/pub feel. TVs everywhere you turn. The bartender is really nice even though she was a fan of either Ohio or Oregon, I forget. Well, either way, she was not a fan of SC. :oP

There is a guy who plays piano and sings all songs Dean Martin/Frank Sinatra-esque. Gives the entire place an old school Vegas feel.

All in all, I had an awesome time there. The antipasti were delicious. The wine was fabulous. The game was SHWEET (though unrelated to the restaurant but it just added to my terrific experience because SC won WOOHOO!!!) :o)

Simply the best restaurant in Vegas.

Casa blends the decor of old Vegas with the warmth of an Italian family and food that is consistently *perfect*. 

No ... seriously ... this food is ridiculous.  There's not a single item I've tried on the menu that did make me stop chewing to stare at my wife in wide-eyed amazement.   Everything from the tender meat to the pasta to the sauces to the tangy, perfectly salted house dressing is incredible. 

The staff is friendly and funny, the live music is old Vegas and hilarious.  

You'll eat like royalty and feel like you're in Goodfellas (without all the murder). 

Casa di Amore is the very spirit of Vegas.

I am sooo sorry, Casa di Amore. I didn't realize I never wrote you a review until my mother-in-law talked about how she's coming back and I had to look you guys up again.

On to my review...

I am anti-weddings or should I say I'm anti the weddings *I've* attended. The weddings I've been to in the last few years have been kinda mehh. The consistent theme that I've noticed is that the food is never really that wonderful, which sucks because that's the most costly part. When it came down to planning my whole shebang, I didn't want to throw a $20,000 wedding for 175 people with crappy food. Plus ever since Britney Spears got married in Vegas, I've always had this crazy idea in my head that I should get married there too. So, that's what we did. Our plan: to have a 15 minute ceremony that would have the best damn wedding food and greatest party you've ever experienced. Casa di Amore helped make my big night absolutely flawless. 

We had originally planned for a Brazilian steakhouse that our chapel could package with our overall wedding. The chapel screwed up and forgot to make the reservation with the steakhouse. By the time they noticed their error, they told me the place was booked up. The problem with having your wedding on a hella cool date like 9-10-11 is that everyone  ELSE wants that hella cool date too. We called a bunch of different places on the strip including Maggianos and no dice. My mom, of all people, actually found Casa di Amore and told me to call them. Immediately after speaking with Kathleen, I knew that this was going to be a perfect fit for my wedding. She was absolutely one of the best people that I dealt with throughout my wedding process. She gave me their traditional catering menus but said if we saw something else on the menu we liked, they could change it and edit it. 

The food: we had 30 guests and everyone raved about the food (my dad's review is even on here...look for Russ C.) My husband's family is all 100% Italian, so I was hoping this would live up to their expectation and it did. They all were so impressed by the antipasto platter that we had served as an appetizer and said "Wow, this place is authentic."

And yeah, I'm pretty darn competitive so to hear my dad and step-mom tell me the food was WAY better at our wedding than at my step-brothers, well that was one of my proudest moments of 2011. 

The service: our waiters were great, very attentive and personable. They were happy to make wine and champagne suggestions but didn't try to push anything extra on us.

The $$$: Kathleen only made us pay a small deposit of $100 to reserve the space for us. She followed up with us throughout the whole process but sent us another follow-up email the day before just to make sure we were still good to go and that we didn't want to change anything. We thought the prices were extremely fair in comparison to how much food and how amazing it was.

Ambiance: so fun! There was a lounge singer there that night and my guests loved it. We got a free show while we ate.

If anyone is thinking of doing a dinner here, I would highly recommend it. The process is easy and Kathleen will put your mind at ease. OR if you've been there, done that on the whole wedding thing and are just thinking about a nice date, doooo it! It's great to get away from the strip and experience a little old Vegas. They also have limos that will come pick you up as long as you make a reservation and call in advance.

Definately a place that is a little cheesy and has the Cliche of what one would expect from Italian food in Las Vegas. However the food is very good and the service is very strong. A great date place for people that don't take themselves seriously and wan't to have fun. The Steak Flambe was very good and the Chicken Picatta my friend had was good as well.

Probably the best hometown Italian restaurant I've ever had! (And it's in Vegas!!!)

When you first find the place, it's sandwiched between a Dutch Bro's coffee house and a gun shop/range (very quaint location). Then when you walk in, you are transformed back in time, probably in New York around the 1960s or 1970s. A time where live music was happening, and the service was very personable. 

I went there with my boyfriend and his stepmom. We arrived around 6:30 pm or so and was seated immediately. Our waiter did some small talk with us, then got our drink order. I couldn't decide what to order so I did some more chatting with the waiter and asked for his recommendations. 

My bf stepmom ordered the Shrimp Scampi which she enjoyed very much. My boyfriend ordered their famous Baked Lasagna which was really delicious. The plus side of ordering the lasagna was that they gave more meat marinara sauce if you wanted more of it. (So all you meat marinara lovers have at it!) As for me, I got the Linguine Luciano which was so delicious! Their portion was huge! and I wanted to finish every bite of it but didn't have enough room in my stomach for it. I guess I shouldn't have gotten a cup of their Grandma's Famous Chicken Soup prior to my meal. However the soup was so good how could you not want to finish that???

Since it was my boyfriend's birthday weekend, the band played Happy Birthday for him and we got a Cannoli! Which was really good! 

Overall experience: service, setting, and food... 5 stars!!!
Totally will come back when I'm in Vegas and recommend anyone to come and eat there. Oh yeah... if you happen to be in town and you wanted to get to this place but don't have a car or don't want to drive. You could make a reservation prior to your visit and get complimentary limo service from them. (Something to think about.)

Happy Eating Everybody!

I do not often write reviews, but this place needs to be documented...
I am an executive chef and I have worked for some of the most prestigious places including Buckingham Palace. 
On this visit I joined some friends and I was so glad that I got the invite. Smith the Manager greeted me as always what a guy he remembers all his guests. We got to the table where some appetizers had already been ordered and arrived a few minutes after we did. Brad who was our servers is outstanding...He remembered my drink and asked if I would like to enjoy my usual Gin and Tonic...For someone to remember such detail is awesome! George was singing as usual, NOW if you haven't been here before George is an amazing "Entertainer", If you close your eyes sip you Martini its just like listening to "A young Frank Sinatra". 
We put our orders in and I ordered the Daily Special with Modifications I wanted to try the Risotto. I am so glad that I did...This dish blew my mind, I would rate this is as one of my all time best Risotto dishes. I have had quite a few especially as I did part of my Chef Training in Genova, this rates right up there with some of the best. My friend ordered the Cioppino and this was so rich and flavor full, the sauce was divine...

I have to say as a restauranteur I am amazed that the labor turnover is so low, this shows one thing that the team members want to be here to work, most have been there over a decade...

When visiting Las Vegas this is a must visit place I know it not on the strip but a 15 minute jaunt off the strip is totally worth it...They can even send a limo...we got one back to the Hotel...
This is a secret that the locals all visit....YOU NEED TO VISIT THIS PLACE...DONT LEAVE VEGAS WITHOUT DINNING HERE
My second favorite Italian place in LV. Great good, good service, and "old Vegas" atmosphere. Try it, you will like it.

Came here for the 1st time tonight and I have to say I am very happy I did. I ordered the homemade cheese ravioli with marinara and it was the best ravioli I've ever had. The Caesar salad was delicious too. Only complaint I have is, it does get pretty loud and busy so it's probably not a place for an intimate dining experience. All of my party enjoyed their dish except for one person who ordered their special sea bass. She said it tasted frozen and didn't like it too much, especially for a $40 dish. However, I was pleased and will definitely come back in the future.

This place is a little gem! It's a really nice place to bring a date. Cozy feeling with good live music and an old school Italian vibe. 

The service was great here. Came in yesterday for my bday and they made sure to take care of me. The manager, Smith, was very friendly and it seems like it rubs off on the whole crew there. Michael was our server and he was awesome. He was very knowledgable about the whole food and drink menu and I felt I could ask anything and get an answer (I can be picky and confusing at times lol). It really baffles me when you go to a restaurant and the servers are clueless about the joint. 

The food was delicious and I am excited to come back and try more!!!

When it comes to old school Las Vegas, this is the real deal. It is not a place where you rate just the food...you rate AND enjoy the experience. It's off the strip and next to a gun range. Perfect. Forget the celebrity chefs for a night and do something you will want to tell all your friends about. Really. Do it.

We called last Friday at 7 to make a reservation for 7:30. They say fine, we can make that. So we drive in. We find out that there are numerous parties ahead of us, waiting for a table. After waiting in the crowded bar area for 15 minutes, the host tells us that there are still 3 parties ahead of us. Called up yelp on the iPhone, made a reservation at Strings (a few blocks away) and left the place. 

This is just unacceptable. It's obvious they do that just to attract the customers from the strip (and they are located WAAAY, WAAAY off the strip). If you don't have a table, just be honest and tell us so.  Don't make us come in and wait for one hour.

We were lucky to have gotten in without a reservation on a Tuesday night! Did not feel touristy, but it seemed that most people in the place were not from the area. Loved all the canvases on the wall of Old Vegas--definitely more history than you'll get anywhere on the strip.

The food was good--we split the alfredo and it was a perfect split size. Not very many wines by the glass, and cheaper to order the bottle anyway. Soup and salad does not come with the entree, and I would not recommend spending the extra money--the entree itself was very filling and we had split it! Plus it was nothing that special--chicken noodle "spin off" as some others have said. 

A few complaints: Our server was sort of kissing up to us, but when it came time to get our bill he was nowhere to be found. They also don't seem to have serving sections, so it would have been hard to grab his attention. Luckily the manager(?) walked by and heard us talking about it so he ran the check for us. Also unsure whether bread comes with the meal--we were not offered any and ordered the garlic loaf instead, but the table next to ours got bread with olive oil and vinegar. 

I will give it another chance, but there are other places I'd recommend to out-of-towners.

Great service, great staff!! and the food was good. Our calamari was chewier than we thought, like it had been frozen then fried.  The canolie at the end of our meal was fermented. It tasted old and not sweet but very bitter. Very big choice of Amazing White Wines. This family friendly place, has a live band to keep you occupied in your seats while you wait a while for your meal. The price is a little high, for not getting fresh food. Two days after eating here, my husband and I can't stop going to the bathroom. I'm assuming the food that we thought was okay, wasn't. Go for the wine and the music. My opinion.

The food here was pretty good. I had an Italian seasoned steak that was perfectly cooked and my dad had chicken caprese. The tomatoes on his meal looked like they came from a mass produced hot house and had zero taste. I lived in Italy for 3 years and even a tourist wouldn't get tomatoes like that. He was very pleased with the chicken under the tomatoes and ate all of it. The service was prompt but the server didn't know much about Italian food or pronunciation....lol!

What a fun place to be! Love the atmosphere, decor, no valet parking, and half price wine on Sunday and Monday! There is live performance and totally old NY Italian feel. Awesome! 

The food is good too. The green salad came with real "green" instead of iceberg, the chicken noodles soup is delish, and the bread is warm and addictive. My friend ordered the house favorite vinegar and pepper pork chop and he loved it. The spice and vinegar is too pungent for me but for those who love it, it's great flavor. I had the fillet and risotto special. It's good but not great. The steak over cooked and risotto too mushy. Not gonna dog them for it. Still a great experience. Definitely will return when I'm back!

Totally nailed it! Took a shot in the dark with good reviews and being close to my hotel (way off the strip) 
Old school italian as advertised. This is a small free standing restaurant near the airport and when you walk in, you know its a long time joint. 

I ordered the baked clams as an appetizer and was blown away as to how fresh, hot and exactly like home they tasted. They were prepared perfectly and tasted fantastic. Yum.

Next up was linguine luciano, which was linguine and sauteed calamari in a fra diavlo marinara. I was in the mood for fried calamari, so i asked my server / bartender if they could do it fried. She checked and the answer was yes. Food came and it was a steaming hot, generous portion of fresh fried calamari and linguine in the perfect balance of fra diavlo sauce that was not sitting in a bed of liquid. Again, so perfect and tasted so east coast, i was in heaven.

Sat at the bar for my meal, listened to the nightly house jazz / sinatra band which was the perfect atmosphere for this place. I will be back!!!

This place was really quite good. I'm giving them a rating of three stars for a couple reasons. One the place tries to sell itself as being a little higher class than what it really is. It's in a seedier end of town actually not that nice inside. 
Having said that, the food was quite good. The sauce was good, garlic bread also very good, and they had a surprising prawn appetizer which they wrapped in bacon and served with a peanut caramel sauce. 
All in all a good spot, just know that if the prices were a little lower and you have a better understanding of where you're going it makes for a better experience. No need to dress up

Didnt expect a nice restaurant to be in a location like that.

When we walked in we were greeted by a very friendly staff. The atmosphere kinda reminded me of a nice italian places where a mafia family might have a meeting in the corner table while listening to some amazing live jazz music. (did that make sense?)

The appetizer/entree were both great and the owner/manager even stopped by to say hello and chatted with us for a bit to make sure we were enjoying our dinner.

We were too full to try the dessert so maybe we'll get a chance to try it out next time.
All in all, a great dinner experience and will be back here the next time in town.

Great to take a date. Also good to take family, friends, coworkers, and customers.

Recommend making a reservation b/c it started getting pretty busy after 6:30pm when we were there.
A surprisingly good "find" at a location where you wouldn't expect such a nice place.  The staff was very accommodating & efficient.  Food was good, a very upscale armosphere.

Love this place!!!
Super tasty fresh meals.
Friendly service and great old school Las Vegas: music and decor.
Classy but not overdone!!!
We were recommended to this place by some friends who told us to get the Steak Sinatra. We had it and think it's the best steaks in town.

This place is top notch.  The food never disappoints, but what makes this place special is the staff.  The servers are absolutely outstanding!  The music made our night so enjoyable.  Randy Thomas is so talented and really engages with the crowd.  He played a lot of favorites.  The place was jumpin.'  It was like eating dinner with a huge italian family.  This is a must anytime you are in Vegas.

Over priced I was in shock to see the new menu prices the quality of food was ok but no cigar spaghetti and meatball $23 dollars cut me a break and everything is ala cart The restaurant parking is difficult and doesn't seem safe Will not go back

Continues to remain my absolute favorite restaurant in Vegas!!! I wish there was a way to give this place more than five stars because they deserve an extra five . Have yet to have a mediocre dish. :) MMMM

Went for our anniversary dinner and we loved it! The atmosphere & staff were both amazing ! The food was also fabulous ! We both got the chicken parm with a garlic loaf & a side of meatballs. Everything was amazing. Next time I would get extra sauce on the pasta that comes with the chicken parm. Overall great place. We will be back!

Wonderful food, great entertainment and stellar service. Our server Michael was great. As a gluten intolerant customer, I figured I'd have little to no options at an Italian restaurant. Not only did they have several options, but Michael was quick to navigate me through the menu. The scallops were delicious and my fiancé said that his gypsy pasta was a wonderful spicy dish. If we lived here, we'd be back in a heartbeat. When we come back to Vegas, we'll be sure to come again. "Just remember, leave the gun, take the cannoli"

Thanks to Vegas yelpers, they led me to this place.  I made previous reservations and told the girlfriend we were going out but didn't tell her the details.  She was really surprised when the limo showed up and took us to the restaurant.  

This place is great.  Very old school.  Wine bottles are 1/2 off on Sundays and Mondays. 

So we started with the special appetizer.  Crostinis with buffalo mozz and prosciutto topped with roasted red peppers... MMMMM!!! 

For my dinner I ordered the Osso Buco.  Holy crap.  I had never had it before.  The best meal that I have ever eaten.  And I eat a lot!

This was the best experience I've ever had in Vegas.  If I ever go back out, I'll definitely be hitting this place again. 

With appetizer, 2 dinners, dessert and a half price bottle of wine it was about $110 without the tip. Little pricey, but definately worth it.  Plus the limo ride to and from was free! (I did tip the driver though)

Better than 4 stars, but definitely not 5.

Overall, I liked this place a lot.  Chicken parm was very good.  They have something called gypsy sauce which is a spicy marinara.  It was great.  Tasted the veal parm which was very good.  The shrimp phyllo appetizer was just OK.  Desert was a great cannoli!

DELICIOUS. Honestly, some of the best food I've ever tasted. My friend got the Steak Sinatra, the BEST sauteed mushrooms and steak next to Mon Ami Gabi in the Paris. The martinis---go for the Italian Gatorade, don't get a Manhattan--up. Just DONT do it, tastes like bootyhole. 

As far as service, everyone was more than friendly, the band noticed each and every customer. Ask for Michael, he took impeccable care of us and recommended each of our meals.
I love this place! The food is not cheap, but the environment is great. Kind of loud in our area of the restaurant this time, but it was a loud patron's fault.

Very good place with interesting perks. They offer shuttle service to hotel guests in the area (or to locals that want to leave their car in a hotel near their house instead of driving) and live music daily, for example. Prices are a little steep, though. A meal for 2 cost us $120. If you can spare the $$, it's worth it. 
Brad was our server and he's delightful! He's been here for years, so just ask him any question and he has the answer!
He recommended fried calamari for an app, and it was delicious! Their marinara sauce is amazing!
We had the Fettuccine alla pappasito and Eggplant di amore as entrees, and they were very good. Eggplant was a little too salty for my taste, but still good. 
For desert we had tiramisu and cannoli, and they were both phenomenal!

Went here with a couple co workers last night for half price wine and pizza and had a wonderful time. 
Amazing ambiance. And food tasted absolutely delicious. Server was attentive and made sure we were enjoying ourselves.
Had reservations for 4 on Wednesday night. After waiting 50 minutes were told another 15 to 20 minutes wait for our table. This was unacceptable and we left vowing to never return!  Be warned.

My wife and I and our group of 6 were looking forward to a meal off the strip for a change. I came across Casa Di Amore while reading some other reviews. 

It started out great with their limo picking us up at our hotel (Aria). If you call them far enough in advance, they may have their limo pick you up and take you back to a strip hotel. There is no charge but make sure you tip the diver. He was great and picked up and dropped us off in style. 

The atmosphere is fun in the style of "Old Vegas" meaning pictures of Sinatra on the wall and live music every night. It is very lively and loud. The dress is casual.
 
I am a New Yorker born, raised and currently living. Good Italian restaurants are the norm in NY but I couldn't wait to try some of their dishes after some of the rave reviews. Well, The 6 of us had some starters and 6 different mains. The chicken parm., chicken florentine and the other standards were all fine. But just fine-not more. 

The service also was fine-but not more. And yes-the desserts were fine-but not more.
I will say the wine list was above average.
 
It can also be a pricey evening depending upon what you order.

I would still recommend Casa Di Amore if you want to get off the strip for a meal and experience a little "Old Vegas." It's a good change from some of the more upscale restaurants on strip. If you are in Vegas for 3 nights or more, make this one of your dinner stops and enjoy the limo ride!

Called at 5pm to make a 830 reservation on a Friday night and was told it should not be a problem.  This place is awesome I was here on my 5th anniversary with my Lady and we ended up getting a table right in front of the musicians and it was amazing.  I wish they would have kept playing non stop but I understand that they need to pace themselves and give people time to chit chat.  Great service friendly place I wish I lived closer I would come at least once a month.  Thank You for a wonderful night!

Casa Di Amore' is  a very traditional NY-like Italian restaurant with a Las Vegas twist. There's a lounge singer crooning Sinatra ( primarily) tunes all evening. George Bugatti is amazing. I heard this guy open for Don Rickles a few years back and was blown away. If you closed your eyes you'd think Frank was in the room singing. The food is excellent. The service is over the top. The crowd is neat as its a good mix of locals with tourists.  Our table's top dishes- Osso Bucco and Veal Parm.

Wow!! Never again. This place is so expensive. The bill that I had could have been used for Giada's Italian restaurant on the Strip and most likely could have been a heck of a lot cheaper. Come on, I order a thirty dollar plate and your going to charge me four dollars for the Alfredo sauce? Yes it's a cool environment and the staff was friendly but as soon as we sat down we were advised that there is only one server and it may be a while. For a 160.00 bill your going to staff one server? The food was not bad but got cold after a few minutes. The pasta was not consistent. I'm so sad to leave this.

Small Italian restaurant with a big heart.  Full bar with plenty of seated waiting area. Call ahead for reservations and for free pick-up/drop off limo service.  We went on a Sunday nite (packed) which had live music playing rat pack inspired songs. The chicken dishes were phenomenal, especially the Chicken Florentine and Chicken Marsala.  I had the Linguine with clams (white)....AWESOME!  We were too full to have dessert but the next table over ordered what looked like a chocolate/vanilla delectible...shoulda moved over to take a spoonful. Downside? had to wait just a bit for our table but it was worth it.  The environment is much what you would want a small, dark, hole-in-the-wall type of place to be, serving great food, great drinks, and having a manager care about the service you're receiving.  I would definitely go again!

Great old time atmosphere.  Live music from two very experienced singers. I went back into time here and loved it! Great service from our waiter to the bus boys. Food delicious. Had the special which was sirloin tips in potatoe gnocchi in a lite cream sauce. This was excellent and needs to be on the regular menu! A cannoli was the finishing touch. 

If you visit Vegas you must visit here. Uber, Lyft or taxi will take you here...no excuses!

I love Italian food, and this spot make me recall the time when i lived in Italia 5 years ago. It was memorable. The foods are okay, the price is reasonable for sure. The only thing they should be better is time serving, i had to wait a little bit long.

I looked up this restaurant and read the reviews.  They were excellent and so was our vist.  MICHAEL our waiter was EXcellent.  Food was fantastic and music was great.  Will return fagain.  Very memorial evening.  Thanks michael. SMITH AND THE CHIEFS.

I love old Vegas establishments.  They are devoid of the glitz and forced atmosphere of many of the restaurants on the strip.  This is a small place, all wood and not very many tourists.  The food is decent and it's GREAT to hear jazz.  The only reason I didn't give 4 stars is the music is just too loud.  No matter where you sit.  Management really needs to instruct the band to turn it down.  I couldn't hear my guest without shouting
Haven't been here in a while, and finally went today! AMAZING! They had live music, GREAT food and awesome service! A little on the pricey side, but worth every penny! Great for date night!

My first review.  We had 3 locals/bartenders on the strip recommend this place.  It's  10 minutes  off the strip but totally  worth the s $11 taxi ride.  Forget about the food on the strip.  This is the best Italian food in Vegas.  The waiting staff was friendly, from the bartender to the table server. Highly recommended.

The food here was delicious. I ordered the chicken parm and it was probably the best I've ever had. It was a good portion and so tender and juicy. The service was great and the atmosphere was awesome. There was a live band playing. The prices were a little more on the expensive side. I am use to paying 15-17 dollars for my chicken parm and it was 22 here. After taking a bite into it, it did not bother me one bit. 

This place is located off the strip and you will need to make a fairly decent drive to get there. Thank goodness that Uber is so cheap out there in Vegas.

I definitely would recommend that you come here, you won't be disappointed.

If your looking for great italian food off the strip this is the place.

This place is not that big but it seems like there is always a table.  The food is amazing and they have live performer that sounds just like Frank!  How can you beat that.

We usually start out with a house salad and some calamari and I usually get the chicken Marsala or Parmesan.  Every time it has been delicious.  Usually too full for dessert  but always kill the wine which is very reasonably priced.

Now i'm a asian guy and don't claim to know what great italian food is ilke i do with more asian cuisines.  That being said I have been to italy so i think i have a good foundation.  If that doesn't help maybe this will.  A good friend of mine is Italian-American by way of NYC.  This is the only place he will eat.  Enough said!
If you like the movie Goodfellas & you enjoy authentic Italian food, you have to come here. I absolutely love this place.

Food is always delicious. Get the eggplant di amore and you won't be disappointed! There is plenty to share with enough to take more home.

Ambiance is spectacular. It's always noisy and fun. There is a nightly house band that plays anything from Sinatra to Fats Domino- so much fun!!! 

You will likely wait, even if you have a reservation. Just knock the chip off your shoulder and enjoy. It can be about 45 minutes because the place is packed and no one wants to leave their table.

I've never had a good experience with the limo service. You will probably wait about 1 hour for your return ride, so be sure to request the limo long before you order dessert or request the check. The limos are old and the driver doesn't adjust heat or AC so you'll probably be uncomfortable.

I drove by this place so many times and I finally ate here! It's very cute and small. Inside the restaurant it's "old Vegas" decor with a live band. Attracts the older crowd, but I love enjoying authentic Italian food in a family owned kinda restaurant. The staff was very friendly, and the guy who performed had an amazing Frank Sinatra kinda voice...my kinda jam.  I got the Osso Buco (veal on a bed of risotto rice---very tasty) paired with an awesome glass of Chocolate Shop red wine--which was a sweeter kind of red wine. Great place if you want a little something nicer than Olive Garden with a twist of Vegas authenticity!

I absolutely adore this place!!  I've visited this establishment with three different loved ones and have yet to have a single disappointment!  I took my mom here about a week ago for a dinner date and she said multiple times that the chicken parmigiana has to be the best she's ever had.  I definitely agree!  The price point is a little high, but comparable to other unique Italian dining experiences.  The portions are very big, and the food tastes just as good the next day after being heated up at home..  Whatever you do, have dessert!  I had this chocolate molten cake and my mom had the spumoni, both were equally amazing!

Italian food is VERY easy to mess up..I.E : olive garden..a place where the last thing you taste is something from Italy.

Lots of pseudo places, wanna be homemade spots try to mimic a great Italian flavor but fail tremendously. That is why I am so glad Casa di amore is still around
