The ambiance of the place is great. The tables, the little stage with life performance, the bar and the service reminds me of NYC or san Francisco. Lightinig is very soft making the experience a mix between romantic and sexy.

The food is great as well!. The bruchettas are fresh and tasty and the consistencyof the calamari was great. The antipasto portion is pretty big and presentation is great as well. FYI, their bread and butter is AMAZING..just be carefull you end up like me and eat too much of it .

The entrees were as impressive as the appetizer. My lasagna tasted like homemade, and my friends white sauce seafood pasta was good. We noted that the noodles were a little on the plain side, but the sauces and seafood were able to share some of its flavor with it

Some days this place has some specials on wines . Be sure to ask your server about those before ordering. You might be able to save some money.

If you still have room for desert. Try the Tiramisu or caneloni. Freshly made and packed with flavor.

Hasta la pasta!

I took my newly proposed-to girlfriend (now fiancee) here for a nice dinner and it was thoroughly enjoyable!

I had made reservations the night before by calling in, although you could probably do them online as well via OpenTable or something like that. We arrived slightly early, but we were seated immediately. I can't remember our waiter's name, but he was fantastic. You could tell he was vastly experienced, as I believe he mentioned he had been working there for 10 years! He got a feel for how much time we had to dine that night (we had around three hours before our show) so he slowed everything down for us so we could enjoy each other's company and the wonderful live music, as well as the overall ambiance of the restaurant. 

We munched on the tasty bread and butter that were provided and decided to order some bruschetta to share. The bruschetta was delicious! It's strange how something so simple can taste that good. After a long while we decided to make our entree orders, which were the Gypsy Pasta and the Chicken Marsala. When I told our waiter I wanted the Gypsy Pasta he warned me about how spicy it was and that it was usually not very enjoyable for most people that ordered it. This brought to mind the question of why it was even on the menu, but before I could ask he told me it was because actual gypsies (there were two groups of them dining there at the time) would come in and order it and just love it. In the end, our waiter brought me some of the sauce to sample and, my goodness, it was hot. I promptly ordered some linguini and meatballs with a slightly less spicy sauce!

Our meals were delicious, and my pasta bowl was huge. We had to get boxes to go. It was a great experience. I feel like if I had told someone we had just gotten engaged we probably would have gotten a cannoli or something because there were lots of other people getting them for their birthdays and weddings!

Also, we had the cheesecake with strawberry sauce and it was very good.

To top off the impeccable service, when we first arrived I asked our waiter if it would be possible to use the complimentary limo service to get a ride to the Bellagio where we were going to see "O" after dinner. He said he couldn't make any promises, but that it would probably work out. Turns out he procured us a ride, so we got to show up to the Bellagio in a limo. The limo driver was fantastic. He was playing Star Wars music, so we had a nice chat about the new movie.

We went late on Sunday night and the place was packed and we didn't have reservations. Didn't think we'd need any at that time. However, they were able to seat the 2 of us right away at one of only 2 tables available. The food was phenomenal and the staff was very friendly. Our waiter, Tony, was very personable and attentive. My wife needed to custom order her dish and they gladly accommodated her needs. It can get a bit expensive if you order an appetizer, dessert and a lobster dish. Our dinner for two, even after using a $25 gift cert from restaurant.com was $98 including tip. If you order a canoli or creme brulee, you get a free souvenir t-shirt.

This is a great place to go off the Vegas strip (about a 10 min drive) and they offer a free limo ride to and from the restaurant.  They have half off bottles of wine Sunday and Mondays.  Great Italian food, full bar and live entertainment nightly and the atmosphere is very laid back.  The restaurant looks like a whole in the wall but you must try the food here when you're in Vegas!

Went here with my husband late night at 1 am. Great food and our server was amazing. We got a nice booth next to the stage. Best Italian food I've had in a while. Bit of a drive for me since I live completely on the other side of town but totally worth it. They're also open til 5am which is great since my husband is off late.
You cant turn down a free limo ride! I went here for my birthday, and everything was excellent. Service was top notch, great food, and live music. I would highly recommend eating here.
This place is amazing I got in on New Year's eve with short notice The food is amazing I had to go back to days later and it was still amazing

The food and service was excellent and very fairly priced! They have a live band playing which was a lovely ambience. A little off the strip, but apparently they have a free limo ride that brings you from your hotel to the restaurant and back! definitely worth the visit as compared to those horrible and overpriced food on the strip.

This place is wonderful. Very romantic setting. They do have a live band and it can get loud at times. From our appetizer of crustini to the fresh baked bread garlic butter and the spicy gypsy sauce to dip your bread into. It's wonderful all around. With an extensive wine menu. And there staff if very knowledgeable on all of there wines and menu items. I recommend this for a date night!!

I finally got to try this place out - after having wanting to have gone my past two trips to Vegas.

Res. at 8:30 on a Friday night and the limo was available for pickup at Mirage.  Dunno how we lucked out, but we did.

Well, we weren't seated til 9:15 or so.  This was a little ridiculous.  Fortunately we chatted up a few others around the bar.

Other than that, everything went well.  The vibe is nice, but the dude they had singing was a bit much.

Our waiter was outstanding.  This is what service should be like in the most expensive city in the US to eat in.  We (5 guys) did an order of mushrooms and calimari to start off with.  Mushrooms were great and the calimari was THE best i've had, to date.

Dinner comes and my veal parm is great.  a lil pricey at $30, but it was also the best I've had.  The cheese was melted perfectly - starting to turn brown to give that extra little crisp.

Our limo driver was ok at best.  He didn't really say much of anything even tho I tried shooting the shit with him when he picked us up.  But, for a free ($15 tip) cab ride I didn't complain.

Worth a stop if the limo is available.
Came here while visiting Vegas was looking for a good Italian restaurant ended finding a great Italian Restaurant! Everything from service to food to drinks was excellent a must try!

First of all let me preface this review by stating I have lived in Vegas for over 20 years and have my favorites in town for Italian food and this is not one of them.  I loved the warm cozy atmosphere and the music was a nice touch however it was drafty in the restaurant and very busy.  The food is over priced and the drinks were very expensive.  I got sick after eating the chicken parm.  I am from the east coast and I that's what I was expecting however sadly disappointed.  Chicago joes is better food and less expensive

Got to love old-school Vegas ambiance: velvet walls, high booths, a gaming bar in the back with random regulars popping through the back door. 
 A 1-3 piece music act delighting the room with Mob-age treats.
The food is excellent; the menu extensively covers Italian favorites, classics, and a few twists.  Spicy lovers, do the Gypsy sauce if you can handle it.
They have delicious veggie meatballs.....but you have to pay extra for them......only sometimes.
Bar specials after midnight
Open 5pm. to 5am
Closed on Tuesdays
This place is awesome always was. always will be. it's a little taste of New York.       old-school. good food good waitresses and waiters.

Found this amazing little place on Yelp! Used our restaurant.com gift card to get $50 off our meal as well. Great wine selection, beautiful live music, friendly atmosphere. Shout out to Michael, our server for a job well done. He took our pic, didn't rush us, explained everything thoroughly and was just a stand-up guy. As a restaurant manager, I'm pretty picky about everything when it comes to the service industry. I would hire him anyday to work in my place. Bravo!! We will definitely be back for Michael.

This restaurant is pure old Vegas. You walk in and are engulfed in vintage burgundy and gold. There is a lounge singer who sings the classics loud enough to hear, but soft enough to not intrude. We came hear with two out of town friends. We got the bruschetta and calamari for appetizers. The bruschetta was delicious, with sweet, ripe tomatoes. The calamari though was the star, very lightly breaded and flash fried, it was the best calamari I've ever had. We all shared  a bottle of wine, which was reasonably prices and tasty, a Malbec. For our entrees we ordered fettuccine with shrimp, linguini with clams in white sauce, chicken Parmesan, and gnocchi with prosciutto and spinach is a four cheese sauce. Everyone raved about their entrees. I had the gnocchi and the gnocchi were pillow soft. The sauce was rich and elegant. We ordered molten lava chocolate cake and passion fruit bomb for dessert. The cake was good, exactly what you would expect. The passion fruit bomb was divine, the sorbet inside tart mixing well with the outside, sweet chocolate shell. Altogether the meal was $208, a fair price for an exquisite dinner with excellent service.

A tip for the next time we go... Bottles of wine are 1/2 off on Mondays.

Very cute Italian place off the Vegas strip! It's a small place so you cannot be afraid of small spaces or eating close to your neighbors. It also was quite loud because there was a large party in there of about 25 people and they also have live music playing through dinner. I loved the music I thought it was a nice touch to have some entertainment so you could take your time and eat dinner. The pasta was very good but the bread that most yelpers recommended was not anything to rave about. It actually reminded me of breadsticks from Pizza Hut so I guess if you're in to those..then try it. I actually did not take any pictures because I was too excited to eat that the pics were an after thought! Sorry :) but I would recommend the fettuccine Alfredo and a side of the meatballs! I didn't have room for dessert because I started with a house salad which was also very good. One of the best things about this place is they have a shuttle that will transport you to and from your local hotel but you have to book in advance because it fills up quick! The prices were not much cheaper than anything you can get on the strip but it was still nice to venture out and check out what the rest of Vegas has to offer.

this place is my favorite italian place to eat in vegas. i've lived in town for a while now and it took me some time but i found a place thats worth going to. i'm italian and i grew up in chicago. chicago has the best italian food in the country. this place comes as close as you can get out here. i also live about 40 mins from casa, but its worth the travel every time. consistent and fresh. very good.

I joined Susan and a few others for my first Yelp event : an evening (roundtrip) limo ride to Casa di Amore.  The restaurant sends its own branded red limo to pick up customers on the Strip- more fun than a plain old taxi ride. The limo isn't all that big but I'd never been in one before so it was kind of cool playing with the buttons for the "mood lighting" and the A/C (and laughing as Susan accidentally found one that suddenly separated us from the driver with a metal partition!). :-)   

The restaurant definitely has an old school Vegas feel.  Photographs of Vegas line the walls of the dining room in a chronology, starting with Old Vegas and ending with modern, color photos of the Vegas we see today: gaudy, colorful and sparking! A lounge singer plays the piano and sings old hits such as "Copacabana" (he even had backup singers for that one- don't know where the background sound came from!)  

Some in our group had a vested interest in a football game. A section towards the back of the restaurant sports lounge seating and widescreen TVs showing at least a couple of football games, so they could easily walk back there for a closer look at the game from time to time.  

As a vegetarian/vegan (depends on my mood right now) I was surprised at the paltry salad offerings- I had hoped for a nice big salad for my dinner. Instead, I opted for the small, plain house salad that comes with your order. I chose the penne with greens as my entree (escarole cooked in olive oil). It was very tasty and a bit rich- made me wonder if there was a touch of cheese in it, but I forgot to ask.

Anyway, I had a good time with the charming and funny Yelp crew  (Myke, you are a blast) and enjoyed a nice meal as well.

I asked my limo driver for a recommendation for a place to eat off of the strip and he recommended Casa Di Amore.  I had high hopes because there isn't any good Italian in Dallas, where I'm from. It was the best dining experience I have ever had in Vegas.  The ambiance is fantastic with the live jazz band and everything we had was delicious.  The scampi, linguine clam and the tiramisu.  Not your usually Vegas tourist destination, seemed like a lot of regulars, but a must try the next time you visit the strip.

Italian DISASTER!  This place promotes itself as if it is bigger than it is, so they stuff you in the bar to wait then cram you around a table in the cramped dining room.  Family style?  Not my family.

Yelp this place and it was open from 5p-5a, and it was 12am. Perfect! We had appetizers and took them home with us. The prawns wrapped are delish and the sampler appetizer was also very good. 
While we were sitting at the bar for our food, a server came up to us and started to compliment us on our attire and was very nice and kind. He asked if we seen the live band. He said that we need come back and check it out and was sad to see us take our food to go. 
Definitely going back to eat in the restaurant and enjoy the music and the FOOD!

The food was delicious, once we got it. Unfortunately we waited so long we had to get our food to go. The lack of organization and service soured our experience enough that we won't be returning. We waited 90 minutes for our food due to another party's food coming up around the same time. For a business that has been around this long I would've thought they'd have figured out how to handle that.  That was a poor excuse for letting us wait 30 minutes past when they were "plating" our food for us to actually get it, without giving us the courtesy of checking in to let us know some mistake had been made. The place was swarming with servers, if ours had been overloaded we'd be able to be a little more understanding. 

By the way the crispy salmon is a solid choice. The Alfredo with sausage was good as well. Our sons ravioli seemed like it used the gypsy sauce instead of a standard marinara and our little guy couldn't quite take it.

Thank you Yelpers once again for leading us to another great restaurant based on reviews herein.  We had the distinct pleasure of dining at this hidden gem recently.  We had not planned nor did we have reservations to dine, yet, we were cheerfully greeted by a true gentleman, who did not condescend, but, asked us to "please" wait in their lounge.  We did as bid, and "won" our part of our dinner check at the video games in the lounge.  How much better can it get?  Much, much, better!!!  Once our attention was drawn to the actual restaurant, we discovered wonderful photos, melodious melodies by famous crooners, ie., ole Blue Eyes.  Wine selection: excellent, ceasar salad: excellent, chicken marsala;delicious, Sad, but, okay: pork chop ala Italiano: tough.  Service: more than excellent.  For a dining treat in between losing $, GO, feel, and fall in love all over again with a great and genuine restaurant.  Bravo Casa di Amore.

Somewhere, between the days when the Italian mob used to run this town and today, Italian restaurants in Vegas started acting like the coward bully who only starts picking on people and acting like a big shot when he thinks the teacher is not coming back. Most of them have great food and many of them try to show off their connections to the days of old, pretending to be something they never were and never could be.

Casa di Amore is one of those establishments that has a real connection to Vegas' past, but lacks the pretention of those other joints. Everyone here, from staff to management to the customers who make Casa di Amore their regular stop, is genuinely low key and laid back. They're far more interested in making sure you enjoy yourself with some old-time Vegas than trying to pretend they are some big shot from the glory days.

The food is exactly as good as you expect and never let's you down. The price point is extremely reasonable, especially on half price wine bottle night. 

Stop in and you'll be made to fell at home - with a great meal and a fabulous experience.

This was our third visit.  I highly recommend the place.  Yes, it is situated next to a gun shop in a very off-strip location, but once you are in the door, you are captivated by the retro vibe, the good Italian food and the live music.  We have always enjoyed our meals here.  Worth a visit.  Half price wine bottles on Sunday and Monday are a bonus.

A group of 10 of us had a fantastic time here!  A live musical duo performed fantastic standards and provided great entertainment.  Our service was fantastic even though they were busy.  The food was solid, garlic bread strong, cioppino was decent with a fantastic broth and the wine was enjoyable!  Not my first time here and not my last.
You need to make reservations a half hour before you actually want to eat. Very loud, but great for parties. The food is absolutely amazing!

Our first visit and will not be our last. Husband and I were both impressed with each bite. The marinara was obviously simmered for long hours. You can tell things were roasted, sautéed, and detailed with thought and emotion. He had an chicken parm and I had shrimp scampi; to be safe for our first visit.  We also took a successful chance on Calamari fritti. 
  The staff wonderfully hospitable and entertainment unobtrusive to conversation but so sweet to the lover of crooning nostalgia. It was like having your Mama's dinner on Sunday night, no matter your ethnicity. No fluff: mouth and tummies very happy; AND we have leftovers for tomorrow!!!

NASTALGIC LIVE MUSIC

Yu-go craving calamari. Lightly floured squid fried golden brown served with marinara sauce with the tentacles. YAY!!

Pork chops with vinegar and peppers:  Not just one but two 8 oz pork chops sautéed with olive oil, Italian seasonings,  topped with cherry peppers in a tangy vinaigrette sauce and wedged potatoes.  Added a Caesar salad.  The chops were so "yummylicious" even a starving dog would fail to get any meat off them bones!

Exotic Bomba dessert:  Mango, passion fruit and raspberry sorbetto all covered in white chocolate and drizzled with chocolate... absolutely orgasmic !

Our most friendly server Tony so happens to be originally from the San Francisco Bay Area. Something we have in commom.

Come here and turn back the clock back.  Relive the joy of old fashion Las Vegan dining at its best.
Great old Vegas feel, talented entertainment, delicious food! Definitely an experience to remember!

Totally found a gem!!!!! Thanks to good ol' yelp!!!! Great food! Great service! Tony was such a pleasant server! Very attentive and informative!!!!! If you want a great place to eat off the strip this is your go to!!! Supper yummy!!!!

Old world Italian with good service, great good & charming entertainment. Been there twice with big groups & Casa di Amore did not disappoint! Take the drive away from the strip to get here--you'll be glad you did!

was at this place again....11/29/08. this place opens at 4pm and so i called to ask what was the wait time without resevation and i was told no wait. so we got there at 6pm. there were many open tables. our waitress was Toni. she was good until she forgot about us when i needed more bread and more coke. i stopped eating for a few minutes waiting for her to come by and ask her for bread and coke. 

so i ordered spaghetti in marinara sauce and a coke. my bf has some alfredo pasta with sausage and he ordered a side of meatballs( which is 2 of em). my spaghetti was really good. the house bread is good too..so warm and soft! he liked his pasta specially the sausage. the meatballs were to die for!!! so good! YUMMY!!! i wish i could make some like that. for everything we paid $41. 

there was a guy singing...it was just one guy and a keyboard. he sang christmas songs and played peasnuts songs on the keyboard. my bf really liked that. he loves peanuts specially charlie brown.

Love this place.  Definitely call ahead with a reservation or go to opentable.

Had the zuppa d'clams with white wine. $16.  Dozen large half dollar size clams in a wonderful broth that comes with garlic bread for dipping - although their house bread is yummy for dipping as well.  My friend drank the broth like it was soup!

Also ordered the meatballs as an appetizer.  Wow.  $4 for 2 large meatballs - just slightly smaller than a tennis ball.  I asked for extra sauce to dip that yummy house bread in after my friend drank all my clam broth :/

We ordered the osso buco $42 which is always a hit.  Comes with risotto.  Can get a side salad or soup for an extra $3.  The Caesar had just the right amount of dressing.  Only thing missing was the anchovies.  Special soup today was Boston clam chowder.  My other friend used his finger to clean the cup clean.  What's with my friends and soup?!  I digress.

I ordered the penne pesto (garlic, pine nuts, basil, parmigiano-reggiano with heavy cream $22) I failed to see the page description of ONE POUND PASTA BOWL and ordered grilled chicken as an add on.  I was shocked to be warned that it was a $10 add on but wanted some protein to go with my oh-so needed carb craving so I agreed to it.  Later I found out that you can add chicken to the fettuccine alfredo for only $3 which made no sense but I didn't bring it up.  It did turn my 5 star experience to a 4 star.

My other friends ordered the linguini and clams (oth chopped and shelled clams $24.  Half the size of my penne but he could finish his pasta and I took mine home) and the rigatoni.  Server commented "excellent choice" to the rigatoni order and not to the other 3.  Didn't get the price but he ate it all.  Was on the one pound menu (emoticon with the big eyes)  I tried to look it up on their online menu but it wasn't there but I did notice that several items on their physical menu were not listed.  They also have daily specials.  Today was a grilled chicken and filet tips - both sounded fantastic.  Hopefully they'll have this on our next visit.

PERKS and FREEBIES!!
free t-shirt with cannoli or creme brulee purchase.
free limo service from the strip - bummer doesn't benefit us loyal and awesome locals who want to enjoy some wine with our pasta - or soup if you're my friends. lol

Sooo sorry to add this. Haven't been here in awhile and loved it before. Just not what it was:-( Music was fabulous, service was excellent BUT rating food 6 out of 10! Enlarged the kitchen to NO avail. Food was mediocre at best:-( Definitely one and DONE! Heading west to Mastrioni's.

We were visiting Las Vegas and had this restaurant recommended to me by friends who visit Vegas a lot.  It was my friend's birthday so we wanted to go somewhere fun. The limo picked us up from our hotel, he was on time and very professional.  And then we got to the restaurant.  The place looks amazing.  You feel like you've stepped back in time and that a member of the Rat Pack could walk in any moment.  The service was wonderful. The server made sure to bring my friend a birthday drink, made great suggestions and made us laugh a lot.  And the food was delicious.  We split two bowls of pasta and a salad between three women and were absolutely stuffed.   The wine list is terrific too.  Then cannelloni for dessert which I couldn't eat because I was too full but my friends said it was divine.  This will definitely be our go-to place when we visit Vegas. It was great to be off the strip and hang out around locals.  Plus the band is here is FABULOUS.
I love this place.....The food, the service and the entertainment always makes for a great family night.

Old school Vegas at it's best.  This place is arguably the best Italian food in town.  I had the Eggplant de Amore with a side of meatballs.  Both were perfectly cooked and incredible.  It's a bit pricey, but well worth it for a special night out.

Seriously some of the best Spaghetti & meatballs I have ever had! Casa Di Amore is about 10 minutes away from the strip so it's not something you are going to just come across on the strip but do make an effort to come here when you are in Las Vegas. One of the main reasons this was a planned visit, was due to the great reviews. I will tell you that I was not disappointed at all. The spaghetti was absolutely fantastic, it was perfectly cooked with gigantic meatballs. The spaghetti was very fresh & hot. 

I do wish they would have had a smaller portion as 1 pound was too much for just myself but I tried my best to still finish it because it was that good. It was a smaller place with a great feel to it and the spaghetti was better than I would have imagined it to be. 

The staff was very friendly including our server and food arrived in a timely fashion. As a nice bonus, the server set us up with a shuttle from the restaurant back to the strip at no charge! I thought this was a nice gesture as again it's about 10 minutes outside of the strip where I wanted to get back to anyway. The shuttle was newer, clean & air conditioned. The driver was courteous and our party did tip him which you should do the same as after all it is a free ride. 

If you like Italian food, don't forgot to make reservations when you are booking your trip to Vegas! I will certainly be returning on future trips to Las Vegas.
Excellent food great service old school Vegas all the way. Will be coming here religiously. Our server Bead made our night excellent.

We recently returned to Casa Di Amore after having moved to the other side of town.  Prior to our move we frequented this restaurant often when it was opened 24/7.  Currently it no longer operates 24/7.

Since returning and then checking yelp for reviews, I was stunned that nobody mentioned the table situation since the renovations, because it is bad enough to ruin your dining experience.  One of the unique features about this restaurant is that it has booths to accommodate up to 6 people.  Since the renovation, the owner opted not to replace the tables that fit the booth!  Instead he opted to put TWO  2-top tables together turned sideways!  So these spacious booths now have two very narrow tables, side by side resulting with two people  eating where the two tables meet.  What was he thinking!  In addition, these tables have huge cafe stands which limit your leg and foot room.  The tables also are not balanced to the floor which means you need to be very aware of your plates at all times because they  tilt and swerve.  Who does this?  All the booths in this restaurant now have this impractical table setup.  Michael get the correct tables for your booths.

Another annoying feature about the renovations would be the extremely bright (pink) spot lights on each table.  It is like being in a room with over the top  pink fluorescent lighting in your face.  There is nothing warm about the lighting anymore in this restaurant unless you sit in the bar.  A lighting designer would never use this configuration.  

The food.  The beauty of Casa Di Amore in its day was the quality and value.  The current prices at Casa Di Amore are very  inflated for the quality.  As in Sinatra pricing at the Encore minus the high quality food.  The food presentations are what my Sicilian grandmother would call "half-hearted".  Their signature wedding soup is now loaded with salt, missing the greens (that it use to have) and the broth that years ago you could tell took hours to make fresh, now tastes like it is out of a carton.    Our pasta dishes were delivered to the table unfinished.  As in, someone dumped penne into a bowl and then poured a tiny bit of sauce in the dead center.  Naked pasta is better left for a buffet line.  It was also grossly over cooked.  

One good thing is that Casa Di Amore still has really good entertainment.   Sadly, we won't be returning to this restaurant again.  We will drive the extra few miles to get better quality food, correct tables and elegant dining atmosphere at Allegro, Sinatra or Capos.

This place was SUPER SUPER cute. It is a really authentic mob looking italian place. The food was prompt the service was good. There was a piano guy who was playing requests the whole time we were there. Only downside was that every time the waiter came up to me I totally felt like I was in his way because he was refilling my drink or removing my plate. He even moved my plate away from me when I was mid putting food on my fork!!!!!!!
But besides the overeager waiter the food was AMAZING!!!!!! The chicken parm was to die for and the bruchetta (Is that how you spell it?) was heavenly!!!

I am not sure which good thing to say first, since the entire visit was amazing. I made reservations a couple of weeks before our visit since we would be in town for a few days. This was no ordinary day for us, we were renewing our vows after 25 years and didn't want to go to just any restaurant. We wanted to go somewhere special. Casa Di Amore was definitely that. We arrived still dressed from the big day. We were greeted by multiple members of the staff and congratulated over and over. Even many of the locals (we knew they were locals because you could tell this was their local place to go to eat) stopped by to talk with us. 

We were seated near the entertainment and had a great view of them playing and singing. The food was AMAZING. I had the salmon and it was probably one of the best salmon dishes that I have ever had. My husband had the chicken marsala and he finished the dish and loved it. 

The staff went out of their way to ensure we were having a good time and that we were recognized for our special night. So much so that they had the band announce our names and why were there (to which the rest of the restaurant gave a round of applause and their congratulations, some even stopping by the table) and the band played a song just for us. 

I cannot say enough good things about this place. Please do yourself a favor and get off of the strip, eat at a local place and have an amazing time. We will definitely be back the next time we are in town.

My absolute favorite Italian style restaurant. I've enjoyed the Canteloni, salads and bread! The shrimp cocktail was a old Vegas favorite, too. 

So I stop in on a Wednesday after a long trade show at 9:30. Barely found a spot to park and the place was packed! Only in Vegas. Brad still hamming it up at each of his tables as I ate at the bar - no option! 

The menu has changed, but the same flavors and presentation. I'll miss my old favorites, but grow up fat boy and suck it up! Try something different. This trip I ordered the Chicken Parmesan....this partially due to Peyton Manning and all of the "hammered in your head" commercials on Sunday football. Dang Nationwide Insurance. Class's was no slouch - full of flavor and worth every bite. 

Service is fantastic and I'm sure they make a huge tip base as when people are happy - many go 25%+. Brad is that type of server. 

Anyways - this is just another one of their huge base of Yelp reviews. A true 5 star rating - Enjoy and always win big.

Walked n on a saturday evening around 6:45 and was seated within 10 minutes with no reservation.  Staff and servers were very friendly.  Had a spinach salad, calamari, and gnocchi. Food was great.  Will definetly come back if in Vegas again.  Live music was nice.  Atmosphere was a bit noisy.  

This is a great place to go and get off the strip with all the tourist a holes and drunk people.

So I'd heard about this place a few times, but I had never actually been there.  The most I knew of this place was that the former Frank Sinatra sound-alike that used to be at the Brown Derby at the MGM Grand (now Craftsteak) performed there.  Well, I'll tell you that this is some of the best Italian food I've had here in Las Vegas.  Yes, the place is small, but the atmosphere is wonderful, especially the live music during dinner.  I liked the fact that the singer came from table to table shaking hands and singing.  Also that people felt free enough to dance and to toast each other.  I had the Pomodoro Fresco, which is the pasta with garlic butter and tomatoes.  Yummy!  And for dessert, I had their cannoli, which was absolutely fabulous!  Reminded me of cannoli from the late, great Albina's bakery and also from back east in Buffalo at Ilio DiPaolo's restaurant.  Also, because I got the cannoli, I got a free T-Shirt with the restaurant logo on the front and the immortal line "Leave the gun, take the cannoli" on the back!  So cool!  Will definitely be going back there!

Came off the beaten path from a recommendation from a bar tender on the strip. Wife and were picked up from a limo dispatched to our hotel ! The driver Pamela was hilarious and full of spunk. We always enjoy going to the local spots and this was a home run. Food was amazing, a full of taste and the atmosphere was old school Italian. I had the veal parmiganan with meat sauce, delicious!! The local musicians Roy & Paul we friendly and even greeted us when we arrived. Will come back for sure !!

This place is not good! Service was slow. Food took 30+ minutes to come out and was a just a bit above average, but not great. Food was overpriced as well. Oh!  How can I forget about the entertainment?!! That was so loud and "cheesy"! I'm not trying to be mean, but it was way too much for a Wed night.

The last time we were there the staff was great but the Cook was not.  He would not cook the food the way we asked for which we have asked for the hundreds of times we have gone before.  He was rude and should not be so self absorbed and know that we come for the food and the atmosphere, I am sad to say we will not be going back anytime to so we use to go three times a months minimum but since our last visit we have not been back (over a month and half ago).   Go enjoy but do not let the cook be rude to you, your paying and should get what you order!!!!

We had a rehearsal dinner here for my sons's wedding. The food was great. The entertainment was great and the service was great. It is a wonderful restaurant even if you don't have a special occasion. I have never had better meatballs!

We last dined at this old style southern Italian restaurant in 2005.  We each ordered chicken angelo - mushrooms, olives, and artichokes in a lemon butter sauce plus complimentary cups of chicken pastina soup.  The soup was okay, but the chicken angelo fell a little south of mediocre

The reviews on YELP had me most interested in trying this place when I was in Vegas during my vacation last week.  Everything you read on here is true...it is truly a good place to eat.  The service and food were great!  We even each got a drink for free just for checking in on foursquare.  I had the stuffed pork chopped which were really good, just too much to eat and my wife had the chicken angelo which she also really enjoyed.  We had a restaurant.com certificate that kept our bill under $60 for the meal.  Our waitress, host and gentleman who was singing on stage were all super friendly and superb at their jobs.  The only reason for leaving off one star was the seating was a bit uncomfortable and we both found the lack of lighting to be somewhat awkward.  These are just little concerns for a great meal though.
Take a step back in time into this classic Vegas Italian restaurant. Absolutely excellent food,service, and ambiance. We go every year no matter what !

Everything we ate was amazing, the ambiance was very old Vegas. Has a 2 pc band playing lounge music and taking request. Not cheap but definitely get what you pay for. Service was impeccable. The eggplant lasagna was like nothing I had ever tasted, cheesy and crispy

Nothing but good things to say about this place. Everything was perfect! From the food to the service ( Brad was our server and he was awesome), to the live misc and old Vegas feel. I'm pretty sure we will be back every time were in Vegas. We started with the Calamari and Bruschetta. I recommend both. For our main courses we had the Veal Parm (based on our servers recommendation)... Great choice! And we had the Cioppino.. Loaded with goodness, it was delicious!

Aside from the yummy steak entrees and live music, our server Stefan made our dining experience to this place memorable. We're first timers to this place as recommended by a business associate and Stefan made sure we were attended well. Thanks for taking good care of us!

Holy cow!! This place was amazing. We took advantage of the limo service from our hotel. The limo driver was extremely courteous and professional. This place is classic Vegas. Old school charm, delicious food...even a lounge singer. Our waiter Brad was great, made great recommendations and got everything perfect and timed just right.  I highly recommend a visit to this place whether you are a local or a tourist.

Great food and atmosphere. There was a terrific lounge bad who did some super songs from the 70s.
Chicken parm and Caesar were great!

Great waiters - Amazing Italian dishes...a restaurant that is like a friendly neighborhood of family and guests. Loved the singer and drummer, creating an ambience that was relaxing entertaining and full of good energy. Such a nice contrast to the glitter and artificial fluff on the strip...this restaurant is authentic with genuine Italian cuisine. Thank you Casa Di Amore!

My meal was delicious! We got the antipasta appetizer with fried ravioli, calamari, and mozzarella. Amazing! Super friendly people and waiters as well! The live music is very enjoyable to listen to while eating.

Come for the live entertainment! Great singers while we visited late at night. They also offer a limo pick up from your hotel if you reserve in advance.

The food unfortunately was JUST ok. Ravioli is oversized and a little doughy, but tasty. Order in the blush/vodka sauce which is better than the Alfredo. We tried both.

Caprese was disappointing. The tomatoes looked like they were winter tomatoes (pale!!!) not summer tomatoes (red!!!). Not sure why since we came in the middle of June and this place is in Vegas.

The lasagna was 100% mushy in each layer and was unappetizing. We had to send this back sadly. Also disappointing since this is a very popular dish and we would expect for it to be spot on!

Atmosphere here is divey, dark, and a little tacky with colorful lights near the bar. It seemed like they have gimmicks to get you in and have a great time (wonderful music, limo ride) but the food is just ok.

Service was excellent. Our server took care of us and didn't hassle us about the lasagna. They were packed on a late weekday night and getting our food took a while.

Food was very good,especially stuffed garlic bread, unfortunately,several problems were encountered. We were seated very close to a wedding party, and our chairs were constantly being bumped by guests and servers. The singer, within 2 hours, sang5  songs, 2 of which was happy birthday. Noise level was excessive. Server had no clue if they had certain foods, and manager, at least we thought it was the manager, did nothing but walk around doing nothing all night, till we left, then asked if everything was ok.  drinks were not served in correct glasses. I will try again, since the food was yummy.

We booked this place for our wedding party of 40 with only 4 days notice and without eating there prior- we had never even seen it as we were just in Vegas for our wedding.  We hit the jackpot!  The staff was extremely gracious and wonderful service! My family and friends thoroughly enjoyed the dinner and atmosphere that they were able to provide to us-very old school Vegas with Rat pack pictures everywhere and a 3 piece band singing Sinatra and all the classics.  Another couple even got engaged that night while we were there!  The waitstaff was patient and sweet with our large party. Our children were treated wonderfully.  The band was fantastic and the bandleader took the time to speak to me and my new husband personally and was so sweet as to ask for song requests. WE LOVED IT!   More than one of our guests mentioned that they will be coming back next time and will be recommending to all of our friends.  They even have a limo that you can reserve to pick you up from your hotel-just have to book that ahead of time but we were able to get it on short notice with some luck...

First time eating here and we were NOT disappointed! The Fettucini Alfredo was wonderful but would stood out more than the food was the atmosphere and wait staff. Our waiter Stephen was super attentive as were the bussers and all the other staff helping. The live music was such a nice and classy touch and the restaurant itself was super cute...what I imagine old Las Vegas was like. We would definitely go back!!

I'm sorry to say this was the worst value yet in Vegas.  I've never given anything two stars (you can check my record), and it's hard for me to even write this, but honestly I can't understand the positive reviews.  The only thing this place has going for it is a vintage ambience, but the food was exorbitantly priced for such mediocrity.  My boyfriend and I started with the fried calamari, which had no seasoning and no calamari.  Then he got the chicken special and I got ravioli.  For what little chicken was on his plate over linquine completely drowned in congealed cream sauce, it was remarkably average and needed to be doctored up.  My ravioli, while large, was the same.  We both were looking for someone to come around and shave some fresh parmesan over our meals, but all they offer is the shake can on the table.  None of this would be horrible if our plates were $10 or $12 dollars a piece, but his was TWENTY-EIGHT dollars (always ask how much the specials are first) and mine was $20--shocking (shocking!), to quote Joan Cusack.  For three small plates (the fried calamari, the chicken, and my ravioli), and just two small glasses of wine, the bill was $100.  Worst $100 ever spent on food.  In every other city, we can get two very well-put together and flavorful meals for the price of one forgettable piece of chicken at Casa Di Amore.  So . . .two stars because the food isn't completely inedible.  Just  underwhelming and a terrible bang for your buck.

My husband and our friends were headed to Vegas with some friends to celebrate our 15th anniversary. We wanted to try something authentic and off the strip and I looked at Yelp and found this place.  Since I had never been in a limo I was quite excited that they provide free limo service to and from their restaurant.

We were picked up promptly at 6 at the MGM for our reservation at 6:15.  We were sat immediately and greeted by a very pleasant server (Lynn?) She was very attentive at first but as the restaurant filled up we saw her less and less and seemed like were an annoyance when we asked for something.  

Drinks were very good, so was the bread. My gnocchi pancetta was TOOOO good.  Amazing really. I have had a lot of gnocchi and this was obviously made fresh.  Husband had fettucine and said "meh".

Couple with us had lobster ravioli, he said the sauce overpowered the lobster but that it was still good. They also had steak and it was the best steak i have ever tasted. It actually melted in your mouth. Thankfully it was big enough for her to share :)

We had canole and creme brule for desert.  I have had much better creme brule.  I wasnt impressed.  The canole was pretty tasty tho.

The ambiance is really great. It has the feel of old 50' s mobster style Vegas. Red paint and bricks. Just cool. The live band was awesome and really set the tone singing Dean Martin and Frank Sinatra.

So where does the star fall off of a 5 star rating?  When we went to pay the bill I had a restaurant.com gift certificate (which by the way is a rip - dont use them....lots of hidden fees and rules - pain in the butt).  I gave it tand my credit card for the remaining balance to the server and she disappeared. She brought back a receipt and our friends bill which they paid.  I was confused that I didnt have a receipt for my credit card and tracked her down because she was not coming back to our table. I asked if the bill was settled and she said it was and said goodbye.  The limo driver then drove us to the strip. Half way there we were basking in the great meal and mood of being in a limo and satiated.  When the phone rang. I could hear the limo driver talking about an unpaid bill.  He asked me if  we had paid and I assured him that we had.  He argued with someone on the phone and then handed me his cell phone.  The guy on the other end asked if we had paid and I told him what had happened and said the server confirmed we had paid.  He said for some reason she didnt run our card and therefore I gave him the card info again over the phone.

I did not appreciate the insinuation that we were dining and dashing, especially since we were obviously taking THEIR limo back to the strip.  WTH?  I also didnt appreciate the server not taking responsibility for her mistake and then putting the issue on us while we were trying to enjoy our limo ride back to the strip. I spent 5 of the 10 minutes on the phone with the staff working out payment.

I think they need more servers because our server was fantastic and then when it got busy we barely saw her and this mistake occurred, surely because she was busy.  Still obnoxious.

All told, we would go back but I really was pissed about the payment issue.

This is my most favorite restaurant here in Las Vegas. I love the ambiance and love the food! Staff is pretty good gets really crowded at night so I suggest making reservations.. I suggest stating with the Bruschetta and the caprice.. really delicious! And for the entree i would order their version of a spinach tortillini or their chicken parmesian.. their pizza arent bad either all very good. prices, may be a little pricey but well worth it.. They also have a live band in the evening you may want to call them and ask. I highly sugget this place if you want to relax and enjoy an italian style ambiance with good food. only downside is it is located in the horrible neighborhood just make sure you park your car in a well lighted area..

this place is purely old school and a perfect choice if your on a late flight arriving in vegas (they stay open till 2 am). 

this restaurant is a favorite of the locals and was recommended to us by our cab driver, who was clearly on his game.  the decor is old vegas, so you are expecting frank, dean, sammy or even elvis at anytime. in the case of elvis, please note he would not leave the building until he finished his meal. that's how good the food is and at a reasonable price point!

our waiter michael, promptly introduced himself and was spot on throughout the meal. we had the meatballs for an appetizer which were a generous portion, very tasty and were accompanied by an excellent tomato sauce. apologies, i forgot what my wife had as i was too busy eating,wtf? however she was enamored with her entree as well. 

again, kudos to our waiter michael, who was informative, well spoken and makes you want to revisit as does the food and ambiance.

we shall return!

My wife and I had decided to come here for dinner a couple of nights. We were looking for a place close to my work and UNLV. My wife mentioned there was an Italian restaurant near the coffee shop she frequents. I'm always up for Italian, so we decided to give it a try.

It had the feel of an old school New York Italian restaurant.

For our appetizer we ordered the twice wrapped prawns. It was okay but not nearly as good as I was hoping it would be. The flavors just weren't there.

For our entrees we ordered the pork chops with vinegar and peppers and the eggplant di amore. Both were quite good, and the portions were large. 

The restaurant is a little pricey, so while I may go back, I doubt I'll be a regular.

Place is so solid. Sunday nights 50% off all wine. Good mood music. Great food. Fun staff. Just a really good spot off the strip. You cannot go wrong here. You will leave in a GREAT mood....especially if you get the Veal Osso Bucco. Enjoy.

This is the real deal! Old Vegas. Wonderful homemade Italian cuisine. The live music is wonderful (thanks George!) with the sounds of the 50's. But if there is a request, they will do their best. We were celebrating my granddaughters 21st birthday and I was afraid that this place wasn't to her liking but she said she loved it! Not a big restaurant so be sure to make a reservation. A bit noisy but lively. The service was incredible. A little pricy but for the experience, it was well worth it. They also will pick you up in a limo and take you back to your hotel, complementary. I was told they are closing down next week for remodeling but will reopen with wonderful changes. I can't wait to go back. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because they picked us up in a new red van rather than a limo. When I told my waiter I was disappointed, he made sure we went back in the limo. The food.....amazing!

Casa Di Amore was a great experience and a nice Italian dinner.  We chose Casa Di Amore based on reviews on Yelp and Trip Advisor.  

What really sealed the deal for us to go here was the free "limo" ride.  The limo is technically a limo, but it basically had seating for 4 comfortably or 6 a little tighter.  Either way, it saved about $40 in cabs so it was very welcome.

The restaurant is located in a strip mall on Tropicana and shares space with a gun store.  It felt like a real locals joint.  

The atmosphere wasn't anything special.  There were old Las Vegas pictures and paintings on the wall and a keyboard player was singing Christmas tunes.  I usually hate music when I'm eating, but it was not obnoxious and added to the night.

Everything tasted as if it was made by a friends mother.  For my main course I shared a fantastic Chicken Piccata and Gnocci Bolognese.  Sharing is not only fun, but it's a good way to sample the flavors and not to overeat - something that happens a bit too often.

Casa Di Amore was a very home style type dinner.  It's another nice off the beaten path Italian restaurant in Vegas.  The last time I went a little out of the way for Italian was to Nora's, which was phenomenal.  Nora's is pretty popular and crowded since it's been featured on the Travel Channel.

If you've been there and done that and want another local Italian joint Casa Di Amore is another good option.  The food was very good, but not the best ever.  The decor was nothing fancy, but everything was good and fun.  I'd rate this above average but not great.

Casa di Amore feels homie and comforting and that goes for both the decor and the food. I read that this was one of the best Italian restaurants in Las Vegas so we came here under that impression. Having the bar set as high as it can be, the men in my party ordered the chicken and veal parmesan while us girls asked for an antipasto salad, salmon and bruschetta. My date who's half Italian approved the chicken parm with penne pasta! I tried this dish as well and I thought the chicken was moist and tender; the pasta sauce was delicious - over all a great dish! 

My antipasto salad was good but a bit too acidic for my taste. Instead, I ate some of he bruschetta and I really enjoyed those. 

It can get really loud in here once the live music starts so if you want to eat and talk, perhaps you should show up before 6:30 pm.

Love this place! Yes they were under construction but it's ok. Went with 8 to celebrate my husbands birthday. They were fantastic. The manager didn't charge us a corking fee to open my husbands gift of crown royal since the bar was closed and they were fantastic in serving the cake that I had dropped off. We come here at least once every few months. The food is fantastic! Very friendly server and very attentive!

I've been wanting to go to this place and the wait was worth it.  Very friendly staff and the food was pretty amazing.  Not your usual Italian food.  I was impressed.  I had the stuffed pork chops and it was amazing! A must try for anyone who visits this establishment.  The only thing I would say is that the price is a bit steep for a neighborhood place, but I guess you can't put a price on a hidden gem like this place.  I will definitely come back.

Found this place on Yelp with a ton a of great reviews! I was not disappointed. The service we had was just as amazing as the food. I also enjoyed the decor, old Italian mafia feeling...great place 5 stars! Brad was our server and he KICKED ASS. Ask for him. Cheers!

If you're not up for really crowed and loud restaurants.. This place isn't for you. Food was amazing! Music was wonderful! And the staff was wonderful! First time eating here and definitely will not be my last! Our server Brad was awesome! Love this place!

This place deserves every star.  If you are looking for a real Vegas experience, this is the place. Great food and great entertainment.  George Bugatti doesn't disappoint.  I will definitely make this place a "must visit" every time I go back to Vegas.

Such a gem. This place has an amazing old fashioned vibe, some of the best service I've ever encountered, and amazing food! This place is a little loud with the live music, but they played some pretty classic songs that had the whole place singing along. 

Although it is off the strip, I would say this place is a must. They have a complimentary limo service that will pick you up and drop you back off if you're are staying on the strip, so there's no excuse not to go!

After a 2.5 day video game binge I realized I was hungry, at midnight, on a Sunday ...  so I set out to find some place that was a) open b) would feed me (not just get me drunk), and c) not jack in the box(or anything of the sort).  What I found, was Casa di Amore.

First, let me say that I wasn't expecting very prompt or excellent service given the time and day, but within a minute of walking in I was seated, and very shortly there after had a glass of wine. :D Clearly I was happy with the service.

The menu was quite expansive and the wine selection was very good. After ordering, the wait for the food was relatively short given the time. around 20 min if I remember right. ... WOW! the food ... damn it was good!

The atmosphere was relaxed, not too loud, and quite comfortable all around. The background music wasn't the typical Italian joint 10 song album on repeat, it had quite a bit of variation, still lounge music but at least unique, in a way.

I'll definitely be going back, likely many times. I gave it 4 stars, would have preferred 4.5 though. Only reason I didn't give it a 5 was the price of the food. It seemed everything started at $20 a plate BUT it was worth it.

This is our favorite restaurant in town. When we have to entertain people from out of town or have a special occasion or just a date night, this is our place. We celebrated our engagement here. 

Do yourself a favor and eat the stuffed pork chops here before you die. The best I have ever had. They have a great wine selection. The family and friendly environment adds to the quality of this place. 

You can not go wrong. The prices atmosphere and lets not forget the amazing food have this place right up there with the best of Las Vegas. Sure it's not the most expensive, rare, or trendy place in Vegas, but who the hell wants all of that all of the time?

A little gem in Vegas. We called around 5-6pm for an 8pm reservation. They made no guarantees but promised to accommodate us if we showed up. After a hefty wait at the bar we were seated and the evening could not have gone any better. Service was top shelf. Food was WOW awesome. Drinks and recommendations from our server top notch. The place was full of locals who came for dinner and the house band which was incredible. Hence the reason nobody leaves and the wait was a little long. I don't give 5 but this one was definitely worth it. Next time we will take advantage of free limo service. Too bad five stars is max!
Have never had a bad meal here... tonight was awesome had Roshy for our bartender and she was awesome... food was incredible and the atmosphere was even better
I savored every damn bite. Old school Italian. We stuck with the simple dishes and each was 'slow down mouth this is the good stuff' damn damn damn with a side of hot damn.

The restaurant itself was very unique along with the live two-man band.  However, beyond that not many great things to say.

The cab ride there and back was $50.  They only had one of three limos operating that night so we didn't have any options other than a cab.  We had reservations for 6:45pm.  It wasn't until 8pm that we were finally being seated at our table.  What's the point of a reservation?

The prices are way too expensive for the quality of food.  The pastas aren't even made in house.  The sauces were bland.  I found adding copious amounts of salt gave the food some flavor.  

One other good thing was our server though.  Very friendly and took the time to answer all questions we had.  Was it all worth the far trip and the long wait....no.

We stopped by on a Sunday evening for dinner. I'll get straight to the point, the four and a half stars are well-deserved. If you aren't too worried about price and want some delicious Italian food, just go. 

It was a little busy and we didn't have a reservation, but luckily they had an open table for us. The ambiance feels very old school and cozy. It's a popular spot for visitors, but the service was still quite good.

We ordered Linguini Luciano and Gnocchi. Both dishes were very very good. Some of the best Italian food I've had in Vegas.

It does come at a price though. Expect to spend a little more than you would at Olive Garden.
Amazing restaurant. Amazing food. Amazing entertainment. Amazing ambiance. I would highly recommend anyone to visit casa di amore. It's so beautiful and intimate. Very old vegas

Another hidden gem in Vegas. What a blast with family and friends. Paul Stubblefield stole the show on stage. Great service and food!  Picked us up at hotel and drove us back....great deal with 1/2 price wine on Mondays!

Where the Rat Pack must have held court

This is the real deal for good 'East Coast' Italian food.  No LV strip bling.  It's old school baby!  I've been here 3 times both with a group and just my teenage son.  Great Osso Buco, great service. The pictures of Bugsy's Vegas in the 50's that adorn the walls make it a throwback to a quiet place that the rat pack would hang out to avoid tha paparazzi.  Lots of locals, not a tourist stop.  Live piano and guess what? He channels Dino and Frankie.  Great evening and located not far from the strip.  It's next door to an indoor machine gun shooting range - go figure.  On the way in, you drive past the Liberace museum.  What a city: Gangsters, Guns and Glitter all in an evening's dinner.

We had a great time.  We got picked up promptly by the limo, the driver was nice and fun to talk to, we were seated quickly, the food was really good, the portions were good, the vibe was fun, the entertainment was great and we had a nice conversation with the drummer, and we really enjoyed ourselves.

For the price, I would not go often, but for a special treat, it was pretty perfect.

Excellent as always!  Had the 1/2 off bottle of wine on Sundays, followed by the
baked clams and stuffed pork chops.  Also always get a side order of meatballs to split for an appetizer.  The service is terrific and the live music creates the perfect evening!

Amazing place! My brother and i took our mom here for her birthday... Its an unexpected place ... A hole in a wall kind of restaurant... 

We went in and they asked us to wait at the bar and they will call us when our table is ready... Only thing i would say is me and my brother got some drinks and the bartender creeped me out a little because he kept starring at what i was gonna write on the receipt when i closed out my tab...

Any ways... We got our table and our waiter was really nice... He told us about the specials they had... I got the similar to baked ziti and my brother got the chicken Alfredo.. My moms choice was pretty bomb.. She got the steak rib eye with peppercorns and glaze on it... It was delicious!!! There was a live band playing music which fit perfect with the atmosphere... Definitely recommend this place... Coming back soon!

KiiFood... EXCELLENT
Service..... EXCELLENT
Ambience.....9 out of 10 very loud
Overall experience was very good can't wait to go back. I've lived in Vegas almost 50 years why have I not discovered this gem a bit earlier. My only complaint was the noise level but it was crowded and had tile floors

The best kept secret in Vegas, if not the entire western region!!  Amazing service, live band playing ole favorites that everyone sings to, homemade grandmas marinara sauce, garlic bread, the best drinks, it is like being back in the 1940s!!!!  Oh & you HAVE TO get the garlic bread, I can't even describe this one, it's indescribable!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! 
BEST RESTAURANT EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!

The best Osso Bucco I have ever had. My wife had the Ciopino and said it was the best since 15 years ago in Conneticut. Our waiter Tony was great, Sam picked us up in the tips only limo.  Half price wine on Sunday.  Old Vegas style, I sure wish this place was back home. I will be back every time we return!

We had a large party planned 4 mos in advance, they forgot we were coming, demanded we show  at 4pm, not enough  waiters, food not ready, very few of us ate the food  was so bad, over charged for cheap wine, then we had to be out by 6:15 for there next party, plus no music, sounds great doesn't it!

I will definitely be coming here more often mainly late night because I'm tired of driving to the strip after a night of drinking just to get some good food. I never  realized they closed at 5am! The entrance is in the back and so is the parking. I always thought it looked dead but after driving behind, this place had a nice little  crowd going for midweek 2am! The full menu is also  offered throughout entire business hours.
To start off they bring you a nice warm loaf of bread with olive oil and balsamic. Yum!
The fettucine alla papasito had a delicious, rich, creamy sauce with little sausage meatballs. Very homey, cozy taste. Some people might say it has a little spicyness due to the sausage so if you order a -5 on the 1-10 spicy scale, this one isn't for you lol.
My boyfriend got the chicken parmigiana. He replaced the typical spaghetti w/ marinara for spaghetti w/ alfredo sauce just because that's what he was craving. I was actually really surprised. Their chicken parmigiana is on point! And it's not a thin, flattened out half a chicken breast either. It looked like a full chicken breast butterflied and lightly breaded. Really good! On the picture I took it looks smaller than it actually was. He was even a little surprised and said it was better than Magianno's (he works there).  
It's a little on the pricier side for what they offer, a little more than cheesecake factory but I don't mind. I just love that they're opened so late! Our server, who was also the bartender made sure to keep checking up on us even though the bar was full of people. Good customer service and really friendly also. He didn't make us feel uncomfortable for ordering food or anything that late at night. Will definitely be back!

It was very, very loud.  In part due to a live Jazz duo (drums and keyboard). Dim lighting.  Rip in the plastic bench booth seat.   

Service was ok - fast enough, but inconsistent.   (We had to mention we never got our drinks).

The food was unremarkable and somewhat disappointing.  Not bad - but my baked ziti variation featured overcooked pasta.  Inexcusable in an Italian establishment that should know what al dente means.

There are so many choices in Vegas, and the best I can say about this place is: the parking was very convenient.

Just realized that for claiming not to be 'An Italian food Fan', I seem to eat at a lot of Italian places.  My friends like Italian.  We were out and about around Nov. 8th and saw this place as we drove by.  I remembered reading about it in one of our Vegas Weekly magazines.....so a quick "U-Turn", and we were at CASA DI AMORE. 
ATMOSPHERE: 4-STARS, Even tho this was Friday and we did not have reservations, the host did not make a big deal.  We waited at the bar for about 15 minutes or so and were seated. I liked the two-man band and old time songs. Just a nice casual little dark, dive- type place. Old Vegas.
FOOD: 3-4- STARS, good basic Italian.  Not wonderful like LAVO, but 'go back, good'.
SERVICE; 4-STARS, attentive and good.
PRICES: 3 STARS,  Pretty much in line with regular Vegas prices. 
I will go back for a second try with my many Italian foodie friends.

It is the best pasta I would recommend everybody thank you so much they have the best service
They have the best dessert thank you again
I will come again I will tell all my family and my friends

Awesome atmosphere for a group or a romantic dinner.  Great wine list too.  The wait staff are on point from the time you walk in the door. 
Stefan our waiter never let us sit and feel unattended. 
I ordered spaghetti with meat balls and sausage.  Absolutely delicious, not overly saucy and the pasta was cooked perfectly.   The 2 meats were seasoned like my grandmother had made them herself.
My wife had fettuccine alla pepasito. It was a wonderful dish.  It had just the right amount sauce and seasonings.
Our friend had the gnocchi.  She was extremely happy with her dinner (she's been here 10+ times).

So if you're in Vegas for a getaway please try this awesome restaurant out and see what we found out tonight...old school Vegas still exists!

I came to eat here with a party of 12, and they also had a moderately large wedding reception in the middle at the same time, but they could handle everyone just fine. Apart from the surreal positioning of being in a booth on the edge of some stranger's party with no real partition other than a walkway, we were impressed by the food and service here. The mostaciolli with marinara is what I ordered, and it was fantastic. Their marinara is very flavorful, which I prefer to the meat sauce, which is a little dry and spicy. They have a decent wine selection if that's your thing. Plus, you can go blast an automatic assault rifle next door afterwards and fulfill your Godfather fantasies. Only in Vegas.

Late night hole in the wall find for us. We met up with some people here around 2 in the morning. Friendly crew there, mixed bag of patrons which was cool Met some nice people there.

Ordered the meatballs (didn't try them but those who did, raved) I had a chicken breast and green pepper pizza and it was damn good. Thin crust, just the right amount of sauce and not over cheesy and greasy. Good stuff!
The perfect resteraunt!  From the service to the food, this place is top notch!  The best Italian resteraunt I have been to in Vegas hands down!

ATMOSPHERE:  Aside from the perimeter of booths, the tables are so close together in one big room it feels a little like a beer hall or cafeteria, so it feels a little crowded and loud.  However, the Love Shack gets props for being too dark to see the prices and very old school Vegas/Italian. I can't imagine going on a night without the live entertainment which made the experience.  

The night we went it was one older black guy and one older white guy singing mostly 70s easy rock and R&B covers. They should call themselves "Grey".  "Hi, I'm white" "And I'm black", "And together we're Grey".

SERVICE:  Great, but it's the kind of place that gets super busy, so we ordered drinks, appetizers, and entrees all at the same time just in case.  

DRINKS:  Not weak. And the bar has video poker/keno/blackjack. And if you want to eat in the bar, they will give you something that looks like a cutting board with high heel clogs.

LIMO/VAN:  You better reserve that in advance.  We missed the limo, but the manager hooked us up and sent us home in the shuttle as we stumbled out.

FOOD:  We shared the bruschetta.  The bread was kinda crouton-ish, but interesting and yummy.  The meatballs (a side for $4) were perfect.  I made the mistake of ordering the gypsy sauce even though I was told that on a scale from 1 to 10 in spiciness it was a 15.  It was like someone dumped a whole red pepper flake shaker into it.  I sweated throught it, and the server gave me some McDonald's coffee to cool my mouth down.
The only Italian place we eat at in Las Vegas. Food and service is amazing!

What a bizarre little restaurant. Friend and I were driving down Trop and craving Italian. Saw this place out of the corner of my eye and decided to swing in. Didn't have high hopes because of the name (seemed a little cheesy), but figured it was worth a shot. There is some sort of inner-dimensional time shifting porthole just outside the front door, because as soon as you step in the restaurant you transported to Brooklyn circa 1978. 

The place was packed, and I mean wall to wall. Grabbed a seat in the bar and just fell in "like" with the place. I can only describe the whole event as surreal. There was even a guy at the bar that looks like he was cast out of "Goodfellas." I still think he was paid by the restaurant to be there. 

Service was good, ambiance was outstanding, food was 4/5 stars. Had stuffed ravioli, the cheese was great, but pasta was not great. Salad was very good with a house made dressing. Also ordered spaghetti with Gypsy sauce. They will warn you that it is spicy. Let me warn you, IT IS SPICY. I had to dilute it with marinara. Very good though, and the meat balls were great. 

Would have given 5 stars but I thought it was a little pricey for both location and quality of food. Also, I am pretty sure my Johnny Walker Black was a Red. Might have been a mistake on the order from the noise of the festivities, but I got charged for a Black. 

I would go back, mostly for the ambiance and that Gypsy sauce. I recommend it, but stay away from drinks or your bill will be high, high, high. And make sure you stroll through the bar to see if they have the "Goodfellas" guy there, he made my night just by his presence alone.

My man surprised me with an impromptu dinner here. I was still in my work clothes covered in liquor and muddled fruit (I'm a bartender) but I decided to leap at the chance for some tasty old school Italian food. 

So yummy to the tummy! Brad (I think that was his name) was our server and just a delight to talk to (its amazing how nice people are when you smile and are polite...a lesson to the inexperienced diners and all-around rude people out there). He led us to the best dishes on their vast menu (I had the osso buco and garlic cheese bread). He also was very helpful in picking out the ideal glass of Super Tuscan wine. 

The night couldn't have been better. It was a much needed break from my kids and work. I loved the music, the lighting, the food and the service. Will definitely be back.

Food was good.  I wouldn't say it is fine cuisine, but it was good.  Basically just good down home cooking. The reason this place is so cool is what I would call the ambience and the old Vegas feel to it.  I would definitely come back for the experience and bring some out of town guests to see an old Vegas feel and what seems more like a locals place.
I really enjoyed this restaurant.  It was very quaint and had a small jazz lounge appeal.  The food was good, the staff was friendly and the live music was awesome!

I am a vegas local born an raised and I was driving by this place a few years back.  Their are a few other Italian restaurants in town that have gotten rave reviews but as far as I am concerned, this is one of if not the best places for Italian food in Las Vegas.  The food is always cooked fresh and is very good.  They also bake their own bread.
  
  I almost always sit at the bar in the back and gamble and drink.  Service at the bar, or if you decide to dine in, is always phenominal.  Keep in mind it is a small dining area and bar, however, it is well worth the wait.  I honestly have no bad reviews on anything.  Food, service, gaming, etc.  

  I will be trying a few places around town to compare and will write a follow up about a week or two from now.  If you are from out of town I would highly suggest this place for your Italian fix.

Even with a reservation, it took about 45 minutes extra to seat our party of five.   This is a small, very busy restaurant with limited space once you are inside.  Seating is congested and you need to get accustomed to the general noise level which includes the live music and  chatter of waiters and customers

Surprisingly, I was the only one of our group to order a regular meal off the menu.  I chose the Chicken Alfredo which I found to be a nice size, tasty and fairly priced.  The others in my group elected to try various side dishes for their meals including a tasty meatball and various pasta options.  Overall, most of our group felt the portion sizes were larger then they wanted to eat and were happy with the smaller plate options.

Service was attentive, prices were fair and the noise level was higher then we would prefer. .

We had eggplant lasagna, shrimp scampi, eggplant parnassian. All three were great. Waiter suggested a little extra marinara on the side, great idea. Tiramisu and cannoli very tasty, and we got a T-shirt with the cannoli! Decor was nice but aging, waiter said they're remodeling in May 2015.

I never have a bad experience here and I think that is more because of the amazing service than the amazing food. 

My girlfriend and a friend of ours stopped in here on Saturday night after a long day of baby shower planning/shopping. We didn't even realize it was Saturday night at prime time (6:00 p.m.) until we walked inside and the place was PACKED. There was a wedding reception being held as well as regular dining reservations. We didn't have a reservation, but the manager came over and said, "You can have this booth but you guys have to be done by 7:30, and that should give you plenty of time. Does that work?"

OF COURSE IT WORKS. 

We got the garlic bread loaf (heavenly) and I got a Caesar Salad to start. Yum! I love their dressing!!!!! I ordered the special for the evening - Lobster ravioli (tossed in Vodka sauce) and it was perfect. It came with NINE HUGE ravioli stuffed to the brim with deliciously fresh lobster meat. The sauce tasted great too, and I know my vodka sauce - trust me! ;)

My gf got the chicken parm and she almost finished the whole thing. That's how you know something is good! I had a few bites and really liked that the chicken was moist but not too thick! Our friend got the fettuccine alfredo with chicken and she barely even looked up from her plate before she finished eating. So, I'm assuming it was perfect. 

Overall, I give the food a 4.5 (it's not THE BEST ITALIAN FOOD IN THE WORLD but it is VERY GOOD) but the service gets a 5++++ star rating. Brad, our server, was on his toes all night. He had recommendations, explained the menu, was friendly, never let any of our drinks get even close to empty, and had things taken care of before we even needed to ask. Thanks, Brad. 

I like that this place is away from the strip and I really love how dark it is inside. There's usually live music in the form of a 50's era style crooner and the decorations are flawless. Stone brick wall - PERFECTION. 

Check it out!!

Loved the music, the old memories of Vegas on the walls and the atmosphere.  The food was fantastic and the service was perfect.  We had four different plates at the table and each and every one was as good as it gets.  The portions were large enough that no one finished their plate.  We had no reservation and stopped by about 6 pm, they sat us immediately.

This classic Vegas throwback is always a safe bet. Pizzas and pastas are old school and always perfectly prepared. The live entertainment adds to the whole experience. They also host an outstanding Super Bowl party every year. Multiple, humongous 12 foot HD screens, everybody gets a seat, cheerleaders, drum line, all you can eat, all you can drink. Can this little party Casa Di Amore throws get any better. Yes it can! This year at Las Vegas Hotel which means you happen to be in the same building as one of Las Vegas' sport book. So yeah, place your bets if that's your thing too. Super crowd spanning all ages. Those 12 foot screens with a sound system to match makes this event as close to being there as possible. This is one Super bowl party that is hard to beat. It's their 7th year so they must be doing something right.

The best! THE nicest people work here and shared their restaurant with us. 

Joanne makes an amazing cold, dirty martini with blue cheese stuffed olives. She couldn't be sweeter. 

Paul is the entertainment director and plays the drums while they belt out Sinatra and Deano hits. He's dapper and quick with a smile. 

If you're looking for classic, old school Las Vegas this is it.

The good, the bad or the average first? - I will start with the good.

The good....The restaurant is far enough from the strip to avoid a majority of the tourists, but not too far where the cab ride will be more than a couple of glasses of wine. We walked into the restaurant and man was this place packed, but not a touristy, crazy, I gotta get outta here packed. It literally felt like I walked into a scene from "The Casino". Family and friends were sitting at tightly packed tables chatting and laughing, a live two man band was against the wall belting tunes and the walls reflected old school Vegas pics. MY KINDA PLACE, I WAS AT HOME!

The bad...My three person party walked in for our RESERVATION, told it would be a few minutes, so made our way to the bar. The first 45 minutes of waiting was not too bad, but as our wait dragged into over and hour it was clear that people were just not leaving their tables (and why would they when the wine is flowing and fun is being had). The bar and walls around the bar were packed with other parties waiting....waiting......waiting.
